loans.use: Increasing stock by purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Mrs. Hong Doek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of eight people is located in Chheu Neang Khpos village in Takeo province. Mrs. Hong D. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Peou Ek, is a healer.  Mrs. Hong D. is 55 years old and the mother of child who is a person to put the music to the phone for saving. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire laborers and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим Гафуров проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Абдурахим по специальности "врачом" проработал более 25 лет. Вот более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатыый скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abdurahim G. lives in the Gissar region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a housewife. Abdurahim has worked as a doctor for more than 25 years. Now he has been doing animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. He feeds and sells large cattle on the market. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson M. is 35-years-old and married with two children. He stays in Kiwanja near the University where he operates his business. This is a rural-urban set up and his customers are mainly students the University. He has been in business for the last 4 years.

He has borrowed funds from another Microfinance but was later on introduced to KADET by a friend. Benson is involved in various activities, like photocopying, printing services and he is also operating an MPESA(money transfer) Business on the side.

He intends to buy two more computers so that he can diversify his services to the students. His future long term plans include getting into the real estate business to secure his financial stability.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying  two more computers

loans.name: Eunice Ajune

texts.en:
Eunice O. is a 35-year-old lady who is married to Sylvester. They have three children, ages 6, 7 and 9. She has been selling charcoal for the last eight years in Kondele, a populous slum in the outskirts of Kisumu city. 

Eunice learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend who is an existing client. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to increase her stock of charcoal in order to satisfy the demand of her clients. 

She aspires to develop a plot of land, which she has purchased, and start a more environmentally friendly business.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Increase the stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: By purchasing more silks and raw materials to make more cloths.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Садулло Меликов проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сам Садулло "врач", жена "домохозяйка". Врачом Садулло проработал более 23 лет. Но вот как более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
M. Sharofat is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Sharofat is doing all she can to ensure the best future for her children. That is the reason that she has been running her own business for 17 years already. She has a place in the central local market for selling foodstuffs such as rice, macaroni, oil, sugar, spices and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. The business is stable and that allows her to improve the level of her family's living conditions. Now Sharofat needs a loan for increasing the range of goods she sells. For this purpose, she requests 4,800 Somoni. Sharofat and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Increasing stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort E. sells gari, which she prepares using cassava. She buys the cassava in large quantities, mills it and fries it to get the gari, which she sells at the market in Elmina. Comfort has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a cleaner. Comfort has been selling gari since 1980. She contributes to the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to fry for sale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
M. Gulbahor is a dynamic and ambitious 43-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. For about 13 years, Gulbahor has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she has gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown, allowing Gulbahor to contribute significantly to her household. Now Gulbahor requests 5000 somoni to purchase dried apricots, so she can process and sell them. Gulbahor hopes that she can continue to provide her children with education, so they will get an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone who is supporting her.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Racheal Waithira

texts.en:
Rachael N. is 33-years-old and married with three children. Her husband Edward is a contractor. She lives in Muthure, Kikuyu from where she operates her poultry business. She has been in business for the last four years.

Rachael was introduced to KADET by her friend who was already a member at the time and she has never borrowed funds from other sources before. She has already taken five loans with KADET which she has been able to repay without any difficulties and on time and this will be her sixth loan. She sells eggs to brokers who in turn sell them to small traders.

She plans to invest it in her poultry business by buying more Layers for eggs and then buy more feeds so that she will get the best output out of her investment.

Rachael hopes to grow her business so as to be able to supply eggs to not only shops, but Big organizations , and big hotels as well.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding more poultry and buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
M. Farogat is 44 years old. She and her husband have three children. To improve her family position and support her husband with family expenses, Farogat started her business 9 years ago. She is baking “lepeshka” at home. Having the customers, Farogat is selling the majority of her products just from her place.

Farogat is doing all the best to ensure her children have the best future. Now she requests $1,200 USD that she is planning to spend on the purchase of flour at wholesale as required for her business. Farogat is grateful for all who are supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the flour as a wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Mrs. Oeurn Mak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of thirteen people who are located in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. Mrs. Oeurn M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.

Mrs. Oeurn M. raises pigs. She also owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. For this plantation, she needs a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Oeurn M. is 49 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. South Chorn, is a policeman.

Mrs. Nget P. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. sells clothes at Elmina. Elizabeth has received a senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a ward assistant. Elizabeth has been selling clothes since 1999. She supports the upkeep of her family.

Her loan will increase her capital to buy more clothes for resale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale at the market.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба Сулаймонова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Матлюба более 18 лет проработала "доктором". В данный момент занимается животноводством. Она откармливает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот, потом  продает. Муж занимается предоставлением услуги "такси". Кредит просит для для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Matluba S. lives in the Gissar region. She is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Matluba has been working as a doctor for more than eighteen years. At this time she does animal husbandry. She feeds large and small cattle and then sells it. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est mariée à Paul, chauffeur de profession. Marie vit avec sa famille à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Marie vend chez elle à la maison des produits vivriers (riz, haricot, maïs, sorgho…) et des savons. Marie a besoin de mieux développer ses activités afin de fidéliser sa clientèle. Mais pour y arriver, Marie a besoin de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi, Marie sollicite de crédit de la part d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de savons et de sacs de haricot.

loans.name: Stephen Majani

texts.en:
Stephen O. is 31 years-old, married to Caroline Wiyala and both are blessed with one child. His business is located in Eldoret town and he has been in the tailoring business for the past nine years.

Stephen was introduced to KADET by a group member and with the loan he has applied for, he intends to buy more materials for his tailoring business. 

In future he intends to diversify to a bigger store for his tailoring business and have more money to design and sell more clothes in wholesale. He would also like to buy a plot and be able to educate his children at an institution of higher learning.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying more materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Rufiza

texts.en:
S. Rufiza is 31 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband (pictured) has the business of processing of the wheat and in order to support her spouse Rufiza for more than 4 years dedicates herself to raising livestock. Her earnings have helped her to purchase more animals to raise, which she does over a period of 4 years. At one month’s time, she sells them at the Sunday market. Now she decided to request a loan of $ 1000 USD to purchase young cattle and fodder for them. Rufiza is very content with her work because, together with her husband, she carries out her enterprise and her dream is providing an education for her children.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the young cattle

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
Z. Sadriddin is 34 years old. He is married with two children. Sadriddin is running the business already for 5 years. He is selling the household appliances such as: TV set, air conditioner, refrigerator and many others in his store. The business generates the significant income for the family allowing improving the living conditions. Today Sadriddin requests $800 USD. He is going to spend the loan for purchasing new goods for selling. Sadriddin is very thankful for those lenders who supports him.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for selling.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi A. sells fish and groceries like milk, Milo (a milk beverage), sugar and other food supplies. She buys the fish from the fishermen at the seashore and sells them at the market in Elmina. Naomi has received senior high education. She is a single parent with four children and is responsible for the upkeep of her family.

Naomi has been selling fish and groceries and so on since 1999. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell and also to buy more groceries to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and more groceries to fill her shop

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед Ашуров проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Чамшед более 4 лет занимается производством. Он производит национальные сундуки(шкатулки). Он имеет постоянных покупателей, которые купив товар продают его на рынке подороже. Киент просит кредит для закупа сырья, чтобы изготовить новые виды.
texts.en:
Jamshed A. lives in the Gissar region. He is 23 years old. He is married and has one child. Jamshed has been in manufacturing for more than four years. He makes traditional chest boxes. He has regular customers who sell his goods for more on the market. The client is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make more varieties.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Sarah sells bread and also rice, which she buys and then resells in smaller quantities at Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Sarah uses her income to support the payment of her children’s school fees. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more rice for sale and also for ingredients to bake more bread to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell and more ingredients to bake bread to sell

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna M., a 57-year-old widow, lives with her eight adult children, three of whom are already working. They live in Merryhomes Subd., Novaliches, Caloocan City. Fifteen years ago, Digna M. started her general store business with a handful of items to sell and a few hundred pesos in investments. Now, she makes daily sales of up to P2,000.

Digna joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008. She is now on her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P14,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell in her store. She hopes to expand the business in the future so she can help employ some of her neighbors.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells drinks, she has been in this business for a year now and desires to expand the business. Taiwo is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase drinks to sell so as to be able to meet the demand of customers. Her customers appreciate knowing she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. is married and has five children. She has no educational background. Theresa sells charcoal, which she gets from burning wood, she buys the wood and then buries it in the ground before burning it to get her charcoal to sell at the market Elmina, which she has been doing since 2001. Theresa adds her income to that of her husband for the up keep of the family. Theresa will use the loan to purchase more wood to use as charcoal for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to educate children.

loans.use: Theresa will use the loan to purchase more wood to use as charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lambake

texts.en: Lambake sells provision and started this business a year ago, she joined LAPO two years ago. Lambake is 35 years old and married with three children whom she said are their priority as couples, whatever the husband provides she add from her profit to make sure the family feeds, cloth, pay house rent and look after aged parents. The family is based in Lagos. Lambake hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provision to sell and also meet the demands of customer’s continuously. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provision to sell

loans.name: Winifreda

texts.en:
Winifreda G., 42, known in her community for her durable made-to-order shoes and other footwear, including sandals and flip-flops, is married to Carlito, 44, a shoemaker. They have two children aged 20 and 16.

Winifreda manages a small shoe repair shop on the ground floor of her house in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, where she and her husband have been in business for more than 20 years. They also buy used shoes, repair them, and sell them back to customers. They make leather wallets and bags as well. She earns P25,000 a month from these activities. A member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for two years, Winifreda is applying for a loan, her eighth, of P12,000, which she will use to purchase raw materials (such as soles, nails, leather strips, and adhesives) for their business. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for shoemaking/shoe repair (leather strips, nails, adhesives)

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en:
Jumoke is 35 years old and married with three children. The family is based in Lagos.

Jumoke sells provisions and children’s wear and has been in this business for the past three years. Whatever her husband provides for the home she adds to from her profit to make sure it’s enough for the family to feed, clothe, pay house rent and look after aged parents.

Jumoke joined LAPO two years ago. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase children’s wear to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase children’s wear to sell

loans.name: Akouavi Louïse

texts.fr: Akouavi Louïse est née le 21 Juin 1961 au BENIN. Louïse est veuve et mère de 6 enfants, à sa charge. C’est du charbon de bois que Louïse vend. Mais Louïse achète le charbon à crédit et rembourse son fournisseur après avoir fini de vendre. Louïse ne veut plus acheter de charbon à crédit, mais aller à la source en acheter afin de faire plus de profit. C’est pourquoi Louïse sollicite le crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouavi Louïse was born on the 21st of June, 1961 in Benin. Louïse is married and the mother of 6 children, whom she cares for. Louïse sells charcoal. But Louïse purchases the charcoal on credit and repays the supplier after she completes her own sales. Louïse does not want to purchase the charcoal on credit; she would like to go to the source to purchase it, in order to increase her profits. This is why Louïse is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda O. is from Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She is a 50-year-old married woman with two young adult children aged 20 and 22 years old. Florenda and her husband work as partners in their single-minded pursuit of providing their children with a better future and a more comfortable life. Florenda operates a general store within their community and at the same time she buys and sells sugarcane to supplement their family income. Her husband raises pigs in their backyard. While the General store provides a steady daily income, raising pigs has also proven to be a lucrative, income-generating activity. This is the reason why Florenda is borrowing PHP 29,500 for her 18th loan to expand their piggery business, and also to use some of the money as capital to harvest the sugarcane she already owns. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets for her husband to raise and to pay for harvesting her sugarcane

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A., married to a secretary and the mother of two children, has been selling ground nut paste since 2007. Educated through senior high school, Rose produces the paste herself, buying the ground nuts from the market, frying and then later milling them into a creamy form to sell in a market at Elmina.   She supports the upkeep of her family, and her loan will enable her to buy more groundnuts to prepare her groundnut paste for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to prepare her groundnut paste for sale.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise est née en 1966 à Ouidah au Sud du BENIN. Denise est mariée à Louis, commerçant à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Denise est mère de 5 enfants. La famille vit à Godomey dans la Commune d’Abomey-Calavi, non loin de Cotonou.  Denise vend des condiments de sauce ainsi que de poissons fumés au marché de Godomey. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Denise achète ses produits. Denise sollicite de prêt d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître le volume de ses produits pour le bonheur de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Denise was born in 1966 in Ouidah, in southern Benin. Denise is married to Louis, a merchant in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Denise is the mother of 5 children. The family lives in Godomey, in the neighborhood of Abomey-Calavi, not far from Cotonou.

Denise sells sauce condiments and smoked fish in the market of Godomey. Denise purchases her products in Dantokpa, Benin's large international market. Denise is requesting a loan from Alidé in order to increase her rolling funds and grow the volume of her products to please her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a case of fish, crates of fresh tomatoes, crates of hot peppers, sacks of onions and spices.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie M. is a 30-year-old female entrepreneur from Tubuan, Silang, Cavite. Her husband is a local policeman. They have two school-aged children. Margie owns a general store which she started three years ago. She earns P4,000 per week and her business is continuously growing. She recently expanded the business by opening a computer shop and also distributes Avon products. Margie has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for five years now. She is now on her 12th loan with CCT and has recently applied for a new loan of P15,000. She will use the funds to purchase more items to sell at her general store. She will use her profits to refurbish her kitchen sink and cabinet. About CCT CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 35years old and married with three children; she lives in Lagos state and has been in wood business for six years. She says her husband does this trade with her jointly. 
	Francisca hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more wood to sell, she says thank you and promise to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is sixty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Kate says she works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Kate is a trader, trading in tubers of yam which she sells at the market square in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Kate has been in business for ten years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Michael Ndungu

texts.en: Michael M. is 57 years old and is married to Elizabeth Jambi who is 45 years old. They have three children, namely Rachel, Ken and Manase. Michael's primary business is his garage and he has managed the business for the last six years. Michael was introduced to KADET through other clients and he had not received a loan from another micro-loan organization before. With the loan he has applied for he intends to buy more motor-vehicle spare-parts for resale to his clients. Michael believes he is hardworking and in future he aspires to own a bigger garage. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy motor-vehicle spare-parts for sale to his clients

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Mrs. Imelda J. is 53 years old and is married with five young adult children. The J. family presently reside at Brgy. Lopez Jaena, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Imelda’s business is a combination of a "carinderia" (luncheonette) and "sari-sari" (general) store. For fourteen years now, she has been serving home-cooked meals to her customers while selling to her neighbors a variety of goods including grocery items, school supplies and basic commodities. The business nets on the average, PHP 5,600 per month, which is a big help to the family. Imelda’s one mission in life is to help her husband raise their children well, and provide them with a good education to prepare them to have a better future. Now that her dream that all her children could finish school is within reach, Imelda is working extra hard to expand her business so that she could increase her income potential. The current 13th loan amounting to PHP 19,500 that she is borrowing from NWTF-Project Dungganon will be used buy cooking equipment to expand her food business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy cooking equipment to expand her carinderia

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia P. is a 53-year-old single mother living with her three children, the eldest of whom is in college. They live in Pangarap (Dream) Village, Caloocan City. Life was hard for Virginia when her husband passed away a few years back but she didn’t lose hope. She worked hard to sustain their basic daily needs so she decided to go into business. Nine years ago, she put up her small general store with a handful of items to sell until it grew to what it is now. Her daily sales are P500. Virginia joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006 and has been active in inviting other women in her community to her group. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative. Now on her 12th loan, she has applied for a new loan of P12,000 which she will use to expand her store's inventory. She dreams of having a larger grocery store someday. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Afia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey in the daytime by the roadside. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper. She buys her raw material such as maize and other ingredient from Techiman which she claims is cost-effective. Afia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to expand her business

loans.name: Yejide

texts.en:
Yejide sells drinks. She has been in this business for the past nine years and desires to expand her business. She opens her business from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 6pm. She said her business affords her the opportunity to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children and paying their school fees.

Yejide hopes for the loan amount N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell so as to be able to meet the demand of customers. Her customers appreciate knowing she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Mrs. Virgie J. is 52 years old, married with 3 children, and lives at Mapait, Brgy. Suay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Mrs. J. is determined to help her husband by earning extra income so that they can support their family and sustain the education of their children.

At first, Mrs. J. engaged in a pig-fattening business but return on her investment took a long time and could not provide for the everyday needs of her family. This moved Mrs. J. to engage in fish vending. With one of the previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she bought a pumpboat (motorized wooden boat) and fish nets to start her new business. This earned approximately PHP 9,000 per month.

She is using her 18th loan of PHP 15,000 to repair her pumpboat so she can continue with her fishing business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For the repair of pumpboat

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer B., 38, believes that “the best way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.” She loves to cook for her family, especially her husband Jonjie, 38, who works as a driver and a part-time cook. They have four lovely children – all school-aged.

Five years ago, Jennifer converted a portion of their house into a small eatery where she serves “value meals” which are a hit for drivers and students. She makes a daily sale of P 800. Her kids take turn in assisting her in her business, especially on peak days.

Jennifer got more blessings when she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She used her previous loans from the cooperative to sustain her business. Now on her 8th loan, she needs the amount of P 10,000 to venture into an additional business buying and selling pork.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Fresh pork for a new business venture

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia M. sells smoked fish, she goes to the sea shore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen, and then sends it home to process by salting and smoking it in an oven before selling it at the market  in Elmina. Lydia has received senior high school background.  She is married and has three children her husband is a prison officer. Lydia has been selling smoked since 2003. She supports her husband in keeping of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her husband in educating their children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and sell at the market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. sells 'banku'. 'Banku' is a local dish, made by soaking corn and cassava to soften it and then milling it into a soft form before mixing it with water and stirring it on fire to get banku. Mary has no educational background. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Mary has been selling 'banku' at Elmina since 2006. She contributes to the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and cassava to prepare her 'banku'. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more maize and cassava to prepare her banku

loans.name: Hanidena

texts.en:
Hanidena Q. is a 57-year-old widow who lives with her four children in Pangarap Village, Caloocan City. Her husband passed away a few years back so she was left with caring for and rearing her kids.

Hanidena has a small general store in front of her house selling various religious items (scented candles, etc.). She also retails distilled drinking water in large plastic containers. She makes P 500 in a day and even more on Sundays.

Joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 has helped her business stay afloat despite stiff business competition. Hanidena has applied for a new loan of P 8,000 to purchase more items to sell. She is now on her 8th loan.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: More items to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. 

Grace is a trader. She trades in utensils, rubber and plastic products. She hawks and treks to other towns to sell her products. Grace buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for more than 20 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en:
Adeshola is 33 years old and married with two children. She has a shop where she sells children’s wear and baby items. Before, she hawked from place to place but could sell only what she could carry. After joining LAPO, she was able to open a shop.

Adeshola opens her shop every day of the week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid. Adeshola is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more children’s wear and baby items to sell. This, she said, will enable her to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you to Kiva and LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase more children’s wear and baby items to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia B. sells fish and eggs. She buys fish from the fishermen at the shore and resells them at the market in Elmina. Felicia has a junior high school education. She is a single parent and has two children. Felicia has been selling fish and eggs since 2004. She is responsible for the payment of her children's school fees. Her loan will enable her to increase her capital to buy more fish and eggs in larger quantities to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will enable her to increase her capital to buy more fish and eggs in larger quantities to sell

loans.name: Jenniffer Wambui

texts.en: Jenniffer G. is 49 years old, and is married to Tiras Macharia. They have one child, Dorren, aged 26 years old. Jenniffer has managed her goods distribution business for six years and her other source of income is in the auto spares and hardware business which she manages on the side. Jenniffer has not borrowed from other micro-loan organizations before but she was introduced to KADET by existing clients. With the loan she has applied for, she plans to increase her stock of rice as the demand for rice is high. With the extra profits, Jenniffer plans to purchase a plot of land and build a stone house to cut the costs of renting. She also believes she is hardworking and focussed and she hopes to tap into new markets. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase her stock of rice and tomatoes

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. sells jewelleries at Elmina. Charity has received junior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a steel burner. Charity has been selling jewelleries since 2005. She helps in the upkeep of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more jewellery for sale. She hopes  to reinvest into her business with the new profit she will be making.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more jewellery for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is forty-two years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children: one son and four daughters. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Hannah is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over twenty years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. C. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen at the sea shore and then sends it to the market at Elmina to sell. Esther has no educational background.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a prison officer. Esther has been selling fish since 2008. Her income helps support the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en:
Mary W. is 48-years-old, married to Raphael W. and they have two children namely Irene and Margret. She has operated the eggs supply business for the last seven years. Mary operates her business in a densely populated and easily accessible area and she relies mostly on wholesale customers who then sell in retail to other shops.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing group in KADET. With the loan she is borrowing from Kadet she intends to open another eggs supply depot and with the extra profit Mary plans to purchase a pickup so as to make her work easier.

Her hopes and dreams are enlarge her business and enter new markets, she believes she is forward looking and hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya

loans.use: The client Intends to open another eggs supply depot.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells fruit and canned juices, water and drinks. She even sells rechargeable cards. The majority of her sales are to retailers who in turn sell to final consumers. Those who sell along the highways also buy from her because her shop is close to a major road. Buying in large quantity enables her to get a better price and increases her profit on each sale, so she is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell.	Florence lives in Lagos with her family. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is forty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Charity lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in textiles - clothes, underwear, dresses, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the local market. Charity also hawks and treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Winfred Mwende

texts.en:
Winfred Mutene is twenty-five years old and single. She has been operating a cosmetics shop for the last three years.

She was introduced to KADET through a marketing awareness exercise that took place in one of the churches in Nairobi. This will be her first loan and she does not have a credit history with any other Microfinance institution. Winfred believes she is hardworking and focused, and with the extra profit she plans to supply cosmetics wholesale. Winfred's future plans are to own a supermarket of beauty products. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stock of hair pieces and imported cosmetics.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is forty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. Sarah lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in bags of sugar. She sells in a shop by the road side. Sarah buys her goods from Kumasi. She also supplies to retailers in her community. Sarah has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of sugar in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar in bulk

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: I. sells provisions and foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past eight years. She joined LAPO two years ago. I. is forty-seven years old and married with five children, whom she said are their priority. Whatever the husband provides, Sarah adds to it from her profits to make sure the family can buy food and clothing, pay their rent and look after aged parents. The family is based in Lagos.  I. hopes for a loan  of N160,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marlene Guadalupe

texts.es: Marlene Guadalupe P. vive en el municipio de Colon ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Con 32 años de Marlene es una mujer de familia muy trabadora y responsable actualmente vive  con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad y estudiantes. Marlene  ha apoyado a su esposo con la ayuda de su negocio en el transcurso de 10 años consecutivos, posee una venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad Marlene es para invertir en mercadería para su negocio lo que le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlene Guadalupe P. lives in the municipality of Colon, located in the department of La Libertad. At 32 years of age, Marlene is a very hard-working and responsible family woman. She currently lives with her husband and two school age children. Marlene has helped out her husband with her business for 10 consecutive years. She sells clothing, cosmetics, and perfume. The loan that Marlene is requesting at this time will be invested in purchasing merchandise, which will boost profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells drinks and bottled water. She also bakes snacks which she supplies to big schools. Victoria is also a party and event manager, supplying food and drinks at social gatherings. She has been in this business since 2000.

Victoria is forty-four years old and a widow, and has an aged parent and three children under her care. She said since she lost her husband that she has to work extra hard to meet the children’s expectations and their ever-increasing demands. Support is not forthcoming from anywhere.

She is requesting a loan of N160,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and bottled water to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase crates of drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Cecilia is a trader. She trades in sewing accessories such as thread, needles, linings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She also hawks and treks to sell. Cecilia has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es: Rosa Gladys R. L. de 35 años de edad  vive en el departamento de La Paz con su tres hijos Fabricio de 11 años, José de 8 años y María de 4 años de edad. Rosa posee una gran experiencia en las ventas ya que ha mantenido su negocio a flote por quince año,  los cuales le han permitido ganar experiencia y ser reconocida en la zona, Rosa ha surtido su pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal de Zacatecoluca  con la venta de verduras como tomates, chile, zanahorias, entre otros. Rosa solicita un crédito en esta oportunidad ya que desea aumentar su inventario, y solo la ayuda de tu préstamo Gladys podría generar mayores ingresos que son de gran apoyo para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Gladys R. L. is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the department of La Paz with her three children—Fabricio, age 11, José, age 8, and María, age 4. Rosa has vast experience in sales because she has kept her business afloat for 15 years, during which time she has gained recognition in the area. Rosa sells vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, carrots, and others in her small stand at the Zacatecoluca Municipal Market. At this time, she is requesting a loan because she wishes to increase inventory. Only with the help of your loan will she be able to generate bigger profits that will support her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LORENA A. A. TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD Y VIVE CON SU ESPOSO CON QUIEN TIENE YA 10 AÑOS DE MATRIMONIO. ES ORIGINARIA DE LA COMUNIDAD DE LAS TRANCAS EL CUAL PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO DE TLALIXCOYAN. SU LOCALIDAD ES MUY CONOCIDA POR QUE EN ELLA LA GENTE SE DEDICA PRINCIPALMENTE AL CULTIVO DE ARROZ, PEPINO Y MAIZ. SIENDO EL ARROZ EL PRINCIPAL SUSTENTO DE LA COMUNIDAD.

INICIALMENTE ELLA AYUDABA A SU ESPOSO EN LAS LABORES DEL CAMPO, SEMBRANDO ARROZ. PERO COMENTA ELLA QUE ERA UNA ACTIVIDAD MUY PESADA PARA ELLA YA QUE LAS CONDICIONES CLIMATICAS LE CAUSABAN PROBLEMAS DE SALUD.

ES POR ESTO QUE LA SEÑORA BUSCO OTRA FORMA DE APOYAR A SU ESPOSO ECONOMICAMENTE Y SE DECIDIO EN PONER UNA PAPELERIA YA QUE EN LA COMUNIDAD NO HABIA NINGUNA. LA GENTE TENIA QUE TRASLADARSE A COMUNIDADES ALEDAÑAS.

LLEVA APENAS 6 MESES CON SU NEGOCIO Y DECIDIO SOLICTAR UN CREDITO PARA PODER SURTIR MEJOR SU NEGOCIO Y ASI DAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES.

DOÑA LORE COMO LA CONOCEN SUS VECINOS ES INTEGRANTE DE LA  UDE  LAS ROSITAS, LA CUAL ESTA INTEGRADA POR 10 PERSONAS. LAS CUALES SE DEDICAN A LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, VENTA DE DULCES, DE REFRESCOS, VENTA DE ROPA Y CALZADO.
texts.en:
Ms. Lorena A. A. is 25 years old and lives with her husband, to whom she has been married for 10 years now. She is from the Las Trancas community, which belongs to the Tlalixcoyan municipality. Her community is well-known because people there mainly grow rice, cucumbers, and corn—the latter being the community’s main means of support.

In the beginning, she used to help her husband cultivate rice, but she states that it was very heavy work for her, and the weather conditions caused her to have health problems.

For this reason, Lorena looked for another way to help her husband financially, so she decided to set up her own stationery store because they did not have any in the area; residents had to travel to nearby communities.

She has been in business for only 6 months, and she decided to request a loan in order to better stock her store and provide better customer service.

Doña Lore, as she is known by her neighbors, is a member of the Las Rositas Group, which is comprised of 10 people who own general stores, candy stores, beverage stores, clothing and shoe stores.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, crayons, pencil boxes, and poster boards

loans.name: Lidia Alvita

texts.es: Lidia Alvita V. M. de 44 años de edad reside en la capital de El Salvador, San Salvador. Lidia es madre soltera vive solamente con sus dos hijos. Lidia se dedica hace diez años a elaborar la comida preferida de todos los salvadoreños, las pupusas, y así es como Lidia se ha sabido arreglar económicamente hace unos años montando su propia pupuseria la cual hoy pretende ampliar y es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima con la cual lograría aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Lidia Alvita V. M. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in San Salvador, the capital of El Salvador. Lidia is a single woman who lives only with her two children. For 10 years, Lidia has been preparing and selling Salvadorans’ favorite food—pupusas (hand-made corn biscuit-like flat bread that is stuffed with cheese, fried pork rinds, and/or refried beans). This is how she has been able to survive financially. She set up her own pupusa stand two years ago, and she now intends to expand it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase ingredients so that she can increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: magatte F. habite camberene et evolue dans le commerce de tissus depuis 1993.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis plus de sept ans.elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille(150 000)pour accroitre le niveau de son activite et mieux la rentabiliser dans le but de soutenir son mari a entretenir leur famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Rubenia Isabel

texts.es: Rubenia Isabel N. Vda. D. S. D. 51 años D. edad vive en Cuscatancingo municipio D. San Salvador. Rubenia posee su propio negocio, una panadería donD. recibe la ayuda incondicional D. su esposo Don Cruz , quien trabaja en la panadería como panificador, también viven con ellos sus dos hijas Daysi D. 17 años y Catherine D. 13 años ambas niñas se encuentran estudiando. A pesar del pesado y extenso trabajo que lleva consigo Rubenia con la panadería, también  logrado montar una tienda la cual es D. gran ayuda para los ingresos que la familia necesita, ahora Rubenia esta solicitando un crédito por que quiere seguir expandiendo con productos su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Rubenia Isabel N. Vda. D. S. is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the Cuscatancingo municipality in San Salvador. Rubenia has her own business, a bakery in which she receives unconditional help from her husband, Mr. Cruz, who works as a baker. Their two daughters—Daysi, age 17, and Catherine, age 13—live with them. Both girls currently attend school. Despite Rubenia’s heavy and extensive work at the bakery, she has also managed to set up a general store, which is a big help with the family income. Rubenia is now requesting a loan because she wants to keep expanding store inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Lorena Lilian

texts.es: Lorena Lilian G. D. de 42 años de edad  reside en Olocuilta ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Lorena vive con sus cuatro hijos en casa propia. Lorena posee su propio negocio hace veinte años, es una venta de pupusas ubicada en la calle Rubén Darío una zona con mucha afluencia peatonal donde Lorena por su trayectoria en el negocio tiene una clientela muy estable, el deseo de Lorena es poder incrementar sus ventas y eso solo lo lograra con la ayuda de su crédito con el cual ella podrá comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima, que le permitirá aumentar la producción de sus pupusas.
texts.en:
Lorena Lilian G. D. is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Olocuilta, located in the department of La Paz. She lives with her four children in her own house. Lorena has owned a pupusa (a hand-made corn biscuit-like flat bread that is stuffed with cheese, fried pork rinds, and/or refried beans) business for 20 years. Her business is located on Rubén Darío Street, which is an area with a lot of foot traffic. Because of her long career, Lorena now has a fixed clientele. She hopes to be able to boost sales, and will only be able to do so with the help of this loan, which will allow her to purchase a greater amount of ingredients to increase pupusa production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Quadri

texts.en: Quadri sells spiritual items that are used in praying, like incense, oils, crucifixes and so on.  She sells to churches and also to individuals. She has been in this business for close to five years. Quadri is forty years old and married with four children, two of whom are in vocational training while the other two are in school. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase spiritual items in bulk at a reduced price. She says this will enable her to meet her customers' demands instead of losing them to competitors.

loans.use: To purchase spiritual items in bulk

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is a forty-eight year widow with five children between the ages of ten and thirty. Three of her children go to school and the other two are working. Teo doesn't have any responsibility for caring for any additional family members.

She rents a four-room house in a semi-urban area where she lives with twelve people. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs because she both buys and sells from her place of work. She sells the local brew and gin to an average of twenty customers a day. Teo sells to mature people only and works seven days a week.

Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, plus medication. She has been in this business for six years. Teo has been with the Kiva field partner, MCDT, for four years, now servicing her tenth loan, and working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin. Teo hopes to see her business grow bigger.

loans.use: To buy more local brew and gin to sell

loans.name: Amanda Magdalena

texts.es: Amanda Magdalena C. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. Colon del departamento D. La Paz. Amanda vive con su esposo quien es empleado D. una fábrica y su hija Lisseth D. 7 años D. edad estudiante D. básica.  Con 35 años D. edad Amanda ya es administradora D. su propio negocio  posee una tienda ubicada en su casa con la que obtiene ganancias para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, pero Amanda como toda mujer salvadoreña emprendedora también se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo donD. genera ingresos extras. El destino del crédito que Amanda solicita es para surtir su negocio y así seguir ampliando con mayor variedad D. productos  para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amanda Magdalena C. D. R. lives in the Colon municipality of the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works in a factory, and her 7-year-old daughter Lisseth, who attends elementary school. At 35 years of age, Amanda now has her own business. She has an in-home general store with which she earns an income to help her husband with the family expenses. However, Amanda—like all Salvadoran enterprising women—also sells products by catalog, thus earning an extra income. Amanda will use this loan to re-stock her shop and expand it with a greater variety of products to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena O. is married and has two children. He has received junior high school education.

Kwabena sells arts and crafts at Coconut Grove in Elmina, which he has done for eight years now. Kwabena uses his income to pay housekeeping and utility bills and his children’s school fees. He will use the loan to purchase more crafts to sell.

With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwabena plans to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more crafts to sell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en:
Idowu sells drinks and has been in this business for a long time. She buys drinks in crates from those who buy directly from the company. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase drinks from the company directly as this would make the goods less expensive and more profitable for her.

Idowu is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thank you all.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks directly from the company

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 32 years old and married. She has eight children between 3 and 13 years of age; all of her children go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. Aidah rents a four-room house where she resides with twelve people. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Aidah resides in semi-urban area and works there selling charcoal. On average she sells to 20 customers a day. Aidah sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and her residence, plus medications. She doesn’t incur any extra transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for six years.

Aidah has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her fifteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Aidah aspires to see her business grow bigger. .

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group 4

texts.en:
Rina is the leader of the group Mujeres Solidarias. This group has taken out four loans together and has faithfully repaid them all on time. Now they are looking to take out another loan to further grow their businesses and support their families.

Rina started selling clothing three years ago. She sells both from her house and by walking around in the street with a few pieces of her inventory to show her friends. She has slowly grown her business through microloans by expanding her inventory to provide more variety for her clients. She is now seeking another loan to buy more blouses and pants to grow her business even more.

Her goal is to grow her business enough to be able to provide all of her children (ages 15 years, 13 years, 8 years, and 10 months) with a college education. She said it is her dream to someday see her children become professionals and not have to work in back-breaking labor like many other people in her town.

You can help Rina and all the members of Mujeres Solidarias achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel A. deals in men’s attire (second hand clothing) near Elmina. Emmanuel has junior high school education.  He is single and has one chid. Emmanuel has been selling men’s attire since 1997. He is responsible for payment of the bills of his family. His loan will be used to buy more of the clothes he sells for sale. He hopes to reinvest his new profits into his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more of the clothes he sells for sale.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 30 year married with four children aged between 9 and 13 years. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with five people. Robinah takes care of one additional family member.There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She doesn’t incur any extra transport as she buys from her place of work running a bar and on average she sells to 15 customers a day. Robinah sells to mature people only people and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for the eight years Robinah has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more  crates of beer and soda  Robinah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and owning a big bar  
 

.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy M. is married and has two children. She has a senior high school education. Dorothy sells second-hand clothing and also operates a unit transfer in Elmina, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a commercial driver. Dorothy uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of their home.

Dorothy will use this loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorothy plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing for resale at the market.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 52 year married with seven children aged between 12 month and 30 years. Six of her children go to school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she is staying with ten people. Margaret takes care of her mother who is 80 years There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She doesn’t incur any extra transport as she buys from her place of work selling local brew and on average she sells to 15 customers a day. Margaret sells to mature people only people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication. She has been in this business for the six and half years Margaret has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew .Margaret is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger so that she starts selling beers.  
 

.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local brew and Gin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a 30 year married with four children aged between 1 month and 13 years. Two of her children go to school. She resides and owns a six roomed house where she is staying with five people.Cissy takes care of three additional family members aged 3,15,16 years  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She uses public transport to and from work and works in Kampala city where she sells new ladies clothes, and on average she sells to 15 customers a day.  Cissy sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication. She has been in this business for the one and half years  Besides  this clothing business she also owns a retail shop selling home product goods Cissy has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to  buy more clothing a materials and merchandise for her retail shop. Cissy is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and also owning  a permanent  business premise and home.
 

.

loans.use: To buy ladies  clothes

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora M. sells dry groundnuts, beans, and beef in Elmina. She has been selling these foodstuffs since 1980. She helps in the upkeep of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more of the goods she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in completing a house she is building.

Dora has a junior high education. She is married and her husband is a commercial driver.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts, beans, and beef to sell

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is a dedicated member of LAPO. She is 43 years old and married with four children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase provisions in cartons so as to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase provision in cartons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stationeries equipments in bulk

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah M. is married and has three children. She has primary school level background. Hannah sells groceries like milk sugar, Milo and also food stuffs such as plantain, tomatoes and pepper at Bronyinima near Elmina, which been doing since 2002. Her husband is a fisherman. Hannah uses part of her income in running of the home. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more of the groceries and food stuffs for sale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to start a business for her child by buying a commercial car for him to drive.

loans.use: Hannah will use the loan to purchase more of the groceries and food stuffs for sale at the market.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola buys bread from manufacturers and supplies to shops in her community, she has a vehicle for running this business and has been in the business for over seven years but started borrowing from LAPO two years ago. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more bread to sell. Ola is 39 years old and married with three lovely children who are in a private primary school. She says thank you and promises to repay at due time promptly as she has always done in time past.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac Y. is married and has two children. His educational background is senior high. Isaac sells maize which he buys and resells at the market in its raw state at a new market in Elmina, which he has been doing since 2007. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income in payment of his children fees. Isaac will use the loan to purchase t more maize for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: Isaac will use the loan to purchase t more maize for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is a 38 year married with five children aged between 02 and 18 years. Four of her children Immaculate is a 38 year married with five children aged between 02 and 18 years. Four of her children go to school. She resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with five people. Immaculate doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in Kibuye Market and goes for shopping thrice a week. Immaculate sells fruits and vegetables like  Avocado Sugar canes, Tomatoes, Oranges and Mangoes and on average she sells to 15 customers a day.  Immaculate sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include monthly market dues rent medication. She has been in this business for the last two years Immaculate has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to  buy more Sugar canes oranges mangoes baskets of Avocado Immaculate is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and also owning  a permanent  business premise and home.
 

.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is thirty-one years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. Both of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central Region of Ghana.

Dorcas is a trader. She trades in vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and other food items. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells on a table at the market square. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
At Elmina, Agnes A. sells palm oil, the fresh taste of a locally prepared orange juice, and cocoa drink which is made from cocoa powder. Agnes has junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an ICT (Information and Communications Technology) technician.

Agnes has been selling palm oil, and drinks since 2007. She helps in paying her dependents’ fees and other expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm oil and other goods to sell. She hopes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and other goods to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the 45-year-old single mother of two children aged 23 and 25 years. Both of her children are no longer schooling. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with five people.
