She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Mary resides and works in a semi-urban area. She sells clothes in Nalukongo market and works six days a week. She sells to all categories of people and on average she sells to fifteen customers a day. Her major monthly expenses include monthly market dues and she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.

Mary has been in this business for the last thirteen years and has been with MCDT for five years. She is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes.

Mary is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and also to owning as many as three stalls in Owino Market.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Gabriela Estela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 35 years old and has two children who are 11 and 6 years old. Both of them are currently studying in a private school.

Gabriela grew up watching her mother work with clothes and learned a lot through watching and helping when she could. After high school, she went to fashion design school and after design school she decided to start a dressmaking workshop in her home. Most of her clients ask her to make dresses for their daughters.

Since joining FINCA, she has learned how to manage her savings and carry out the accounting for her business. She is requesting a loan for 600 soles to buy eight bails of fabric for dresses and pants that she makes for children.

Gabriela’s dream is to have an industrial fabric factory that is efficient and produces quality fabrics.

loans.use: To buy eight bails of fabric for dresses and pants that she makes for children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, wheat flour, salt, cooking oil, soap and rice in bulk

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 69-years-old and has been of widow for the past 17 years. She has eight children all of whom are married and 3 of which live with her along with their spouses. Alicia began her business selling chicken sandwiches from her home. Her friend and her created a joint venture selling chickens wholesale. She saved enough money to start her own business selling raw chickens and is still successfully doing business. Currently she buys raw chickens wholesale and distributes them to local restaurants with the help of her son. 

Since joining FINCA, she has learned to manage her loans and make payments on time as well as save some of her revenues. Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in a joint venture with her daughter-in-law opening a shop that sells rice, sugar, and convience goods. Her dream is to grow this new shop into a successful business.

loans.use: invest in a joint venture with her daughter-in-law opening a shop that sells rice, sugar, and convience goods

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a 45 year single mother of four children aged 19 and 25 years. Two of her children go to Teopista is a 45 year single mother of four children aged 19 and 25 years. Two of her children school. She resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with five people. Teopista takes care of two additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area where she  is a market vendor. She doesn’t incur any transportation charges as she buys from her place of work. Teopista sells sweet bananas in Naguru Market and on average she she sells to 15 customers a day. Teopista sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, Feeding the family and monthly market dues. She has been in this business for the last thirteen years Teopista has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy banana clusters Teopista is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and also going to villages directly without involving a third party 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more sweet banana clusters

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena A. sells palm oil, 'kenkey', and other foodstuffs at Bronyinima near Elmina. Philomena has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a public servant.

Philomena has been selling palm oil, 'kenkey', foodstuffs and so on since 1998. She is responsible for the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more of her foodstuffs to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more of her  foodstuffs to sell at the market

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 61 years old and has seven children, all of whom are married and live with her. Her father was a carpenter and taught her husband and three of her sons carpentry. They are dedicated to continuing working as carpenters, making images of various saints and plaster casts. Ana works with children every day, however, she says it doesn’t feel like work because she loves children. Ana needs a loan to invest in their carpentry business.

Since joining FINCA, she has learned to manage her savings and as a result has been able to build her current house. Ana is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to invest in carpentry materials such as wood and plaster. Her dream is that the health of her husband will improve and that she will be able to continue working.

loans.use: invest in carpentry materials such as wood and plaster

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is married and has two children who are 27 and 18-years-old. Both of her children live with her and are studying and working. She had a third child but he died in a car accident two months ago. Carmen is from Ayacucho and came to Lima because her father passed away. She has been working since she was 9-years-old selling flower with her mother. She studied dressmaking and secretarial work in school. She worked for a little while but then decided that she wanted to be more dedicated to her family but her husband became ill and she had to work out of necessity. She sells clocks, radios, and jewelry.  

Since joining FINCA, she has learned to manage her loans and says that the organization has been a tremendous source of support for her. Carmen is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy jewelry and watches to sell. Her dream is that her business will prosper.

loans.use: buy jewelry and watches to sell

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita V. sells soft drinks and also operates a fast food joint at Akotobinsin near Elmina. Zita has received senior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman.

Zita has been selling soft drinks and operating a fast food joint since 2005. She is responsible for the upkeep of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to sell in larger quantities at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete her building.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell at the market

loans.name: Hilda Eugenia

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 53 years old and has five children. Three of her children are married and two of them live with her. Her youngest is going to school at the local public school.

Hilda studied dressmaking and sewing to oblige her husband but she didn’t enjoy the work. Instead, Hilda enjoys cooking and decided to work in a dining hall. Every day she works from 9 in the morning to 2 in the afternoon and in the evenings she sells chicken sandwiches and potato pies. Her sons help her in the evenings.

Since joining FINCA, she says she has been much happier because FINCA charges reasonable interest rates and educates her on how to manage her money. Before FINCA she had to pay very high interest rates.

Hilda needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy seats, tables, a cabinet, and carbonated water to sell along with her chicken in the evenings. Her dream is to expand and acquire a cart so that her sons can sell sandwiches in the street as well.

loans.use: buy seats, tables, a cabinet, and carbonated water to sell along with her chicken

loans.name: 18 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El Grupo “18 D. Agosto” esta representado por la señora Marcela y conformado por 13 miembros entre los cuales 10 son mujeres y 3 varones. La mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como a la venta D. comida, empanadas y refrescos, cerámicas, zapatos, ropa y a la prestación D. diferentes servicios. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group “18 D. Agosto” (August 18th) is led by Sra. Marcela and consists of 13 members (10 women and 3 men). Most of the members have retail businesses selling products such as food, empanadas, soft drinks, ceramics, shoes, and clothing, as well as providing different services. The level of business competition is high, but the members are experienced enough to know that they must offer a variety of high-quality products in order for their businesses to succeed.

The loan they are requesting will be used to augment their working capital and expand their small businesses so that they can increase their earnings. This translates into a better quality of life for their families, which continues to improve each day. They are grateful for the confidence placed in them to continue working harder. The members are starting their first loan cycle together, but they have previous experience working in solidarity groups. Therefore, they promise to give it their all and move forward with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 26-years-old, single, and does not have any children. She recently graduated from university where she studied nursing. She started working in a private laboratory part-time but left after a year to work in a hospital because she wanted to work in an area of medicine that could help her obtain the official title of nurse.

Due to the outbreak of AHN1 virus (swine flu), her hospital has required more uniforms for nurses and more face-covers. Rosa is able to make face-covers and uniforms and has been selling them to the hospital where she works. 

Rosa needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of more fabric material to make more nursing uniforms. Her dream is to keep selling uniforms and save enough money to get her doctorate degree in emergency disaster relief.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 26-years-old, single, and does not have any children. She recently graduated from a university where she studied nursing. She started working in a private laboratory part time but left after a year to work in a hospital because she wanted to work in an area of medicine that could help her obtain the official title of nurse. Due to the outbreak of H1N1 virus (swine flu), her hospital has required more uniforms for nurses and more face-covers. Rosa is able to make face-covers and uniforms and has been selling them to the hospital where she works. Rosa needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of more fabric material to make more nursing uniforms. Her dream is to keep selling uniforms and save enough money to get her doctorate degree in emergency disaster relief.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more fabric material to make more nursing uniforms and face-covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more thread in bulk for making sweaters

loans.name: Totosa Plus Group

texts.fr:
"Totosa Plus" qui signifie "Let's obey" en anglais, est un groupe de 34 micro-entrepreneurs à Kinshasa dont Astrid M. est présidente. Unis solidairement pour recevoir des crédits, ces membres ont déjà reçu 4 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les ont remboursés correctement.
Astrid M. 39 ans, est une femme courageuse, déterminée à réaliser un jour son rêve d’ouvrir une maison d’habillement. Son activité initiale était la vente du riz, haricot et épices. Actuellement, elle vend des gaufres, beignets, œufs et omelettes dans un quartier au nord-est de Kinshasa. La bonne gestion ainsi que l’entretien de bonnes relations avec les clients sont ses atouts qui font prospérer son affaire. Elle tient à élargir son affaire au moyen des crédits reçus de Kiva à travers HOPE RDC. Elle a planifié avec le prochain prêt, de renforcer le stock de ses produits pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients qui ne cessent de croitre. Aujourd’hui, son activité qui lui génère un bénéfice de $40 par semaine. Astrid est célibataire et mère de quatre enfants âgés de 7 à 19 ans dont trois seulement vont à l’école.

loans.use: renforcer le stock en achetant les produits de fabrication des gaufres, beignets et élargir l'activité

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase salon items and clothes in bulk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. sells clothing, scarves, silver pans and maize, at Bronyinima near Elmina. Agnes has received senior high education.  She is single and has three children. Agnes has been selling scarves, silver pans and maize for 15 years now. She is responsible for paying for the upkeep of her home and also paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing to boost her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete a house she is building.

loans.use: buy more clothing to boost her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used spare parts for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucía de 57 años de edad, estaba casada con el sr Anuncio Ruiz, y desde hace 3 años es viuda. Tiene 3 hijos todos mayores y con familia propia, una de sus hijas vive con ella.
Comenta que siempre le gusto el comercio, y que en su domicilio tenía una despensa bien surtida y mucha clientela, su esposo su vez ayudaba con los ingresos ya que se dedicaba a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras por todo los barrios de Lambaré, Asunción, y muchas veces al interior del país, para lo cual contaba con una camioneta para realizar dicho negocio. 
Continúa diciendo que tuvo que cerrar su despensa, a raíz de que su esposo estuvo muy enfermo y tenía que atenderle, ya que estuvo hospitalizado mucho tiempo. 
Actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de uno de sus hijos con quien trabaja en la compra y venta de mercaderías, frutas de estación y verduras,  dice que este trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio porque  sale muy temprano de su casa para poder realizar sus compras y luego recorrer especialmente la zona del Chaco, ya que en esos lugares normalmente hay pocos proveedores que llegan a los comercios pequeños.
También en su tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en la costura, por eso, trabaja con una empresa que le provee de materia prima para confeccionar distintos tipos de toallas. De esos  tipos de ingresos  le está ayudando y de a poco ella está invirtiendo en la mejora de  la  construcción de su casa. 
Le gusta trabajar con el crédito porque le permite acceder a mejores beneficios a la hora de comprar sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Fifty-seven-year-old Lucia was married to Mr. Anuncio Ruiz, but she was widowed 3 years ago. She has 3 grown children who have their own families. One of her daughters lives with her.

She stated that she has always liked retail and that she used to have a general store at home that was well-stocked and had many customers. Her husband helped her with the income at the time, buying and selling fruits and vegetables throughout the neighborhoods of Lambaré, Asunción, as well as other places further inland. He had a truck to do this work.

She went on to say that she had to close her general store due to the fact that her husband became very ill and she had to attend to him since he was hospitalized for a long time.

She currently has the support of one of her children who works selling and buying merchandise, and seasonal fruits and vegetables. She states that this line of work requires a lot of sacrifice because she has to leave her house very early in the morning to shop for products, then travel throughout the Chaco zone because there are few suppliers who visit the small businesses there.

She also likes to sew in her free time, which is why she works with a company who provides her with the raw materials needed to make different types of towels. These two sources of income are helping her, and little by little, she is investing in home improvement.

She likes to work with microloans because they allow her access to greater benefits when purchasing merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, milk, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 30-year-old widow with two children aged 7 and 9 years. Both her children are in school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Sarah doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a poultry farm in Kalerwe. She incurs extra transport costs from and to Mengo Kisenyi where she buys chicken feed.

Sarah sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last three years.

Sarah has been with MCDT for three years and is servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. Sarah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent rental rooms. .

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more salon items

loans.name: Papa

texts.en: Papa G. is married and has four children. He has junior high school education. Papa sells fabrics, clothing and lace at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2006. His wife is a trader. Papa uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Papa will use the loan to purchase more of his clothing to resell at the market. With the new profits from his expanded business, Papa plans to build a new house for his family.

loans.use: Papa will use the loan to purchase more of his clothing to resell at the market.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is forty-three years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana.

Cecilia is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as onions and tomatoes, and other items like soap, salt, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She sells on a table top at the market square. Cecilia has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George B. is married and has four children. He has senior high school education. George sells fish and bicycles at the sea shore at Elmina, which he been doing since 2002. His wife is a petty trader.

George uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. George will use the loan to purchase a new boat to improve his fishing business. With the new profits from his expanded business, George plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat to improve his fishing business

loans.name: Beatrice N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 50-year-old Beatrice M. from Mbeya. She is married with three children, between the ages of 15 and 22.

Beatrice has been running a used shoe business since 2003. Second-hand shoes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These shoes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern.

Beatrice works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week. Beatrice currently earns about 80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more shoes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Beatrice thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Las Cariñosa Group

texts.es: El grupo “las Cariñosas” esta representado por la señora Petrona y conformado por 16 socias las cuales van cursando ya su segundo ciclo demostrando honestidad, responsabilidad y  sobre todo ganas de salir adelante; la mayoría de sus miembros se dedican a la venta de comida, pan, dulces en porterías de colegios, leche y a actividades como la confección de prendas de vestir, carpintería, transporte de pasajeros y a la música. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo mercaderías, insumos y materiales para seguir generando mejores ingresos que cada día se traducen en mejores oportunidades para sus familias, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas con la institución.
texts.en:
The group “Las Cariñosas” (The Affectionate Women) are represented by Mrs. Petrona and include 16 members who are beginning their second cycle of loans with honesty, responsibility and over all, the desire to progress. The majority of the members sell food, bread, sweets in stalls near the high school, or milk or they do activities such as sewing clothing, carpentry, driving passengers or playing music. They have a high level of business skills and the members have a lot of business experience. They know how to grow their businesses by offering a variety of products that are of good quality. The loans that they have obtained will be used to increase their working capital so that they can buy merchandise, supplies and materials that with continue to generate more income so that each day they can provide better opportunities for their families. For this they are very grateful for the confidence they have gained by continuing to work with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La Sra. Mary F. tiene 32 años y esta casada con el Sr. Rubén Darío Martinez que tiene 30 años, el mismo se desempeña como oficial de policía en la ciudad de Caacupé, a 50 km. De la capital del país. Tienen una hija de ocho años que actualmente esta cursando sus estudios primarios.
La Sra. Mary F. habilito la despensa cuyo nombre es Vanina Jazmín en el año 2007. Dicha decisión la tomo considerando que se mudo a un barrio nuevo donde había pocos negocios habilitados por lo que prácticamente no tendría competencia en la zona. 
El préstamo que solicita desea invertir en la compra de mercaderías en forma mayorista como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos de distintos tipos, yerba, harina, productos enlatados y otros. De esa manera tendría un menor costo por las mercaderías y obtendría mayor utilidad por la venta de las mismas.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías en forma mayorista como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos de distintos tipos, yerba, harina, productos enlatados y otros.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana.

Esther is a petty trader. She runs a provisions store in her community. She sells all kinds of canned foods. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions for resale

loans.name: Mwinda Plus Group

texts.fr:
Mbeli I. 60 ans, est dirigeante d’un groupe dénommé « Mwinda Plus » qui veut dire « Light » en anglais, qui est composé de 27 membres micro-entrepreneurs tous unis solidairement pour recevoir des prêts de Kiva dans le but de développer leurs activités.
Mbeli est vendeuse des boissons et des courges devant sa maison dans la partie du sud-ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2004 avec un capital initial de $60. Elle est depuis 2008, cliente fidèle de l’Institution de Micro-Finance HOPE RDC (IMF HOPE RDC) et a déjà reçu 6 fois les crédits qu’elle a remboursés correctement. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt renforcer le stock en achetant des boissons et courges pour répondre à la demande de ses clients et ainsi accroitre le revenu. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons. Son affaire lui génère en ce jour un bénéfice de $15 par semaine. Mbeli est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 18 et 38 ans. Un seul des enfants est scolarisé. Elle est déterminée à développer son activité à travers ces prêts.
texts.en:
60 year old Mbeli I. is the director of a group called "Mwinda Plus", which means "Light" in English. The group is comprised of 27 members; micro-entrepreneurs are all united to receive loans from Kiva together, with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mbeli sells drinks and squash (the vegetable) in front of her house in the southwest part of the city of Kinshasa. She started her business in 2004 with an initial capital investment of $60. Since 2008 she has been a faithful client of The Micro-Finance Institution HOPE RDC (IMF HOPE RDC) and so far she has received 6 loans, all of which she has properly repaid.

She is counting on the next loan in order to strengthen her stock and to purchase drinks and squash, in order to respond to the demands of her clientele and therefore grow her revenues. Her dream is to open a beverage warehouse. Today her business generates profits of $15 each week.

Mbeli is married and the mother of 7 children whose ages range from 18 to 38 years old. One of the children attends school. She is determined to develop her business through this loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and squash to strengthen her business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es: Es un banco comunal “Belen” esta representado por la señora Jenny  y conformado por 15 socios (as) que pertenecen al mismo barrio y de la misma zona todos con actividades comerciales diferentes como la venta de pan al por mayor, comida, cosméticos, ropa, joyas y a la costura de prendas de vestir. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia pero no es motivo de problema para las socias del grupo ya que ellas cuentan con clientela fiel y con su experiencia saben como salir adelante sin problemas.  El crédito será destinado para aumentar o mejorar sus negocios con mas mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos y por consiguiente a brindar a sus familia una mejor calidad de vida La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac B. is married and has four children. He has senior high school education (computer studies). Isaac sells electrical spare parts and also repairs electrical appliances at Nyanta near Elmina, which he has been doing since 1999. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Isaac will use the loan to buy more spare parts for resale and also for his repair work in his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to save towards renovating his house.

loans.use: Isaac will use the loan to buy more spare parts for resale and also for his repair work in his shop.

loans.name: Telezia J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 38-year-old Telezia L. from Mbeya. She is married with three children, between the ages of 9 and 17. Telezia has been running a potato-selling business since 1989. She purchases potatoes from farmers wholesale and sells retail.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Telezia currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more potatoes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business further. Telezia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Anna Ndinohabwe ‘S Group

texts.en:
Anna is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is a 26 year single mother of two children aged 3 Anna Anna is is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is a 26 year single mother of two children aged 3 years and 2 months. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with five people. Anna doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Anna stays in Makerere Kikoni owning a Stationery shop in one of Kampala suburbs.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Anna sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.  She has been in this business for the last three years Anna has been with MCDT for one and half months and servicing her first loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy to stationery like reams of papers and box files and pens .Anna is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a Book shop. 

.

loans.use: To buy more stationery for her  shop

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos está solicitando  su primer credito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es construir una habitación, labora como cajero de la Estación de servicios de PETRONIC en  zona Urbana de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 2 años, actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea,  este joven se  caracteriza por ser humilde responsable, honesto y con muncho deseos de superación personal y profesional,  a pesar que no tiene hijos el ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y paga sus estudios de la universidad, el de dia trabaja y de noche estudia, vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea, en un barrio creciente, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, terminar de estudiar la carrera  y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus padres.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel A. G. tiene 43 años de edad, es viudo desde hace 8 años, tiene 1 hijo mayor el cual vive con el padre y ya tiene propia familia formada.
Desde hace 15 años atrás empezó con el negocio de flete, a principio comenzó solo a hacer distribución terceriza para la misma empresa, pero desde hace 10 años esta realizando el flete directo para la empresa.
Con el crédito obtenido de la fundación mando a reparar su Vehículo ya que el mismo tenía problemas técnico.
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado ya que es su primer crédito en una entidad financiera.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel A. G. is 43 years old and has been a widower for eight years. He has one grown son who lives with him and has started his own family. He began his trucking business 15 years ago. At the start, he was only a third-party distributor for the same business, but for the last ten years he has been providing his trucking services directly for the business. With the loan he has received from the Foundation he is going to have his vehicle repaired since it is having technical difficulties. He is grateful to the Fundación Parguaya for their support since this is his first loan from a financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Oreb Plus Group

texts.fr:
Felly N. est dirigeant d’un groupe des micro-entrepreneurs dénommé « Oreb Plus ». Cette banque communautaire est constituée de 25 membres qui sont solidairement unis pour obtenir des prêts de Kiva à travers l’Institution de Micro-Finance HOPE RDC (IMF HOPE RDC).
Felly 41 ans, est maraicher depuis 1994. Ses champs se situent à la périphérie nordique de Kinshasa qui est aussi la partie la plus peuplée de la ville. Il cultive des légumes et les livre aux vendeurs et vendeuses de différents marchés. Felly a développé son activité grâce à l’expérience solide acquise pendant des années et surtout par la bonne gestion. Il est bien connu dans son quartier à cause de la qualité de ses produits et de bonnes relations qu’il ne cesse d’entretenir avec ses clients. Il est client fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC depuis 2008. Il a reçu 5 fois les crédits et les a remboursés totalement à temps. Le prochain prêt lui servira d’acheter des engrais pour ses champs en vue de répondre à la demande de ses clients et aussi accroitre le revenu. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une maison de livraison d’engrains aux maraichers de son quartier. Felly est marié et père de quatre enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 12 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont élèves.
texts.en:
Felly N. is the leader of a group of micro-entrepreneurs named "Oreb Plus." This community group is composed of 25 members who have united to obtain loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution HOPE RDC (IMF HOPE RDC). Felly is 41 years old and has been a market gardener since 1994. His fields are located in the northern outskirts of Kinshasa, which is also the most populated region of the city. He grows vegetables and delivers them to male and female sellers at different markets. Felly has developed his business thanks to the solid experience he has gained over the years, and especially through his good management. He is well known in his area due to the quality of his products and the good relations that he always maintains with his customers. He has been a faithful client of IMF HOPE RDC since 2008. He has received 5 previous loans and repaid all of them in full and on time. This next loan will help him buy fertilizer for his fields, with the goal of responding to the demands of his clients and also increasing his income. His dream is to open a business delivering fertilizer to the market gardeners in his area. Felly is married and has four children whose ages vary between 3 and 12 years. Three of these children are students.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: La Solución 7 Group

texts.en:
Juliana A. Rosana (second from right) is an enthusiastic and excited to take out her very first microloan.  The coordinator of this group of five women, Juliana is seeking this loan to support her business selling various products such as new clothing, bed sheets, skin cream and shampoo.  Juliana has been selling various products for nearly eight years, and is seeking to expand the variety of products and solutions she can offer her customers.

Living with her husband and three children aged 18, 16 and 13, Juliana is seeking to supplement the family income with her work.  Thus far, she has found business growth to be slow, and as a result her husband has been supporting the family.  With this loan, Juliana is seeking to give her business a push in the direction of being more profitable with the sale of items which proviD. a higher profit margin.

For instance, Juliana has not been able to sell towels and bedsheets before, and with this loan will be able for the first time to offer these products, along with more expensive clothing.  Any extra profits will go into further advancing her business.  She hopes to soon move on to home appliances such as blenders which are more expensive but will yield more profit.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: clothing, sheets, towels shampoo and facial cream

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, two sons and four daughters. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Afia is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of canned foods in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Afia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Aleyda Del Socorro

texts.es: a Joven Aleyda  está solictando su primer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccion de una habitación), trabaja como admisitradora del hotel Nueva Guinea desde hace 2 años, no tiene hijos pero ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en la zona # 1, esta joven  tiene alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral,  es una persona responsable,  que ama su trabajo,  su sueño  es estudiar es seguir estudiando,  tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita para sus padres y para sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
The young Aleyda is seeking her first loan to be able to invest in home improvements (the building of a bedroom). She has worked as an administrator in the Nueva Guinea hotel for the past two years. She doesn't have children, but she helps her parents with household expenses. She lives in the Nueva Guinea urban area in zone #1. This young woman has a strong desire to improve herself personally and at her job. She is a responsible person, who loves her job. Her dream is to continue her studies and to have financial stability, good health, and a lovely home for her parents and future children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a new bedroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is sixty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three sons and a daughter. All of her children are out of school. Abena lives with her husband and some of her children in a family house in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana. She is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from the nearby communities and sells them at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. Abena has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace 12 años se dedica, junto con su esposo, a las tareas agrícolas, su producción principal es la papa y otros tubérculos oriundos de su zona, los cuales cada 6 meses cosecha. La comercialización la realiza en los mercados principales de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad, de esta forma logra los ingresos necesarios para el sostén de su familia. Adicionalmente, cada 2 meses, Ana vende los animales que cría en su establo en la feria ganadera de su comunidad, con lo que obtiene el dinero que cubre las necesidades inmediatas de su familia. Su deseo a futuro es seguir dedicándose a la agricultura y tener más animales en su establo de raza mejorada. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella comenta que integrar el banco comunal al que pertenece le ha abierto nuevos horizontes de progreso, por lo que está muy agradecida y reafirma su compromiso de responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla.

loans.use: Compra de abono y semilla

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 30 años se viene dedicando a las tareas agrícolas, cultivando la papa y otros productos oriundos D. su zona. D. esta forma, junto a su esposo, han sostenido durante mucho tiempo su hogar. Por esa razón y para menguar su trabajo físico, hace algunos años atrás decidieron implementar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, para obtener ganancias con ella y ya no tener que realizar mucho esfuerzo en sus chacras. Los productos que ofrece son los comestibles básicos y más demandados D. consumo diario, por lo que su tienda se ha convertido en una D. las más visitadas D. su localidad y eso les está brindando ingresos económicos estables. Esta la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, donD. trabajar en un banco comunal le ha permitido aprender el valor del ahorro. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería para surtir su tienda con productos D. primera necesidad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Here are members of By the Grace of God group. They are small scale businesspeople base in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. In order to improve their businesses, they have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva. 

Ibrahim S. (middle) is the leader of this group. Ibrahim is forty-six years of age, born in Kambia district, in northern Sierra Leone. Ibrahim is married to a businesswoman and they have seven children together. Some of his children are attending secondary schools and others in primary schools. Ibrahim is a tailor and has been in this business for many years now. He will use this loan to expand his business by buying sewing materials.

loans.use: Invest into his tailoring business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a 56-year-old widow with six sons, all of whom are in school. Abena works very hard to provide for her family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa, in the Central region of Ghana. Abena trades in smoked fish. She buys her goods all the way from the Eastern region, which she says is cost effective. She sells on a table top at the market square in her community. Abena has been in business for over 30 years and is requesting a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee es una joven madre de 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de pastos, los cuales cultiva en sus propias tierras y también vende ganado vacuno y porcino que cría en el establo que acondiciono en su casa. Los principales clientes de Aydee son sus propios vecinos, a quienes les vende grandes cantidades de pasto para la alimentación de sus animales, pues todos son ganaderos. Por otro lado, los animales que ella cría los vende durante el fin de semana en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Aydee está muy contenta por las buenas ganancias que obtiene por su trabajo, por lo que espera para el futuro poder extender sus tierras de cultivo. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene una oportunidad de crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy satisfecha de formar parte de su banco comunal y tiene muchas ganas de continuar con esa metodología de trabajo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de pastizales para sembrar más extensiones de terreno.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y semilla

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 36-year-old married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. Mary lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for their family.  Mary trades in tubers of yam. She buys her goods from nearby towns and sells on a table top at the market square in her community. She has been in business for over 15 years and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 13 años se dedica a venta de papa y alfalfa que ella misma produce. Para ello, se levanta temprano por la mañana, junto a su esposo, para cortar el pasto y velar por sus tierras de cultivo que en los próximos meses cosechará. Aunque su trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, acompañado a los días de intenso sol, considera que es beneficioso para su salud porque respira aire puro que la fortalece cada día y por otro lado, con las ganancias puede sostener a su familia. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, pertenecer a un banco comunal ha significado que pueda aprender el valor de la solidaridad y la responsabilidad en el trabajo, por lo que está muy agradecida. El dinero que ahora reciba será utilizado en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children in her own home. For the past 13 years she has made a living selling potatoes and alfalfa, which she also produces. To do so, she wakes up early in the morning alongside her husband to cut the pasture and watch over the crops she will harvest in the coming months. Although her job requires a lot of physical effort in the harsh sun, she considers it beneficial for her health because breathing the fresh air strengthens her every day and, on the other hand, she can provide for her family with the money she makes. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from Kiva partner MFP, and belonging to a community bank has helped her learn the value of solidarity and responsibility with her work, for which she is very thankful. The money she will receive will be use to purchase sacks of fertilizer to use on her next planting campaign.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 41 años, vive con sus 3 hijos menores en su casa propia. Tiene 21 años de experiencia en la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino, diariamente sale a pastear a sus animales a campos lejanos que requiere de hasta 3 horas de caminata. En algunas ocasiones sale con sus hijos cuando tiene tiempo libre de la escuela. Los animales que cría los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad y la rentabilidad que le producen le permite sostener con éxito los gastos familiares. Para más adelante, Bernardo comprará más animales para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él considera que pertenecer a un banco comunal ha sido muy enriquecedor, debido a que ha crecido como persona y se ha fortalecido en el valor de la responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita será para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y semilla para sembrar pastos que servirán también de alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 41 years old and lives with his three young children in his own home. He has 21 years' experience in raising cattle and sheep. He leaves daily to graze his animals in distant fields, some a three-hour's walk away. Sometimes he takes his children when they have free time from school. Once they are grown, he sells the animals at his town's livestock market, and the profitability has allowed him to have sustained success with household expenses. In the future, Bernardo plans to buy more animals to increase his working capital. This is the fourth time he has requested a loan from Kiva partner MFP, and he considers belonging to a community bank to be very enriching, and he credits it with helping him grow as a person and strengthening his value of responsibility. The money he is currently requesting will be used to purchase balanced nutrition for his animals as well as seeds to plant pastures that will also feed his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his livestock

loans.name: One Word Social Club Group

texts.en:
The picture shows the members of One Word Social Club. They are small-scale businesspeople from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to Kiva partner SMT for the first time to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL each to invest in their businesses.

Ibrahim C. is the leader of this group. Ibrahim was born in Magburaka 30 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One of their children is in primary school and the other is still not of school-going age. Ibrahim is an Okada (motorbike) rider and has been in this profession for two years now. Ibrahim will add some money to his loan in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two twins who are just one year old. She sells clothing at Zhidachev town. She has been in this business for 7 years. Oksana is very creative in her business and has many new ideas as to business improvement and development. She talks a lot with her clients and helps them not only to with their purchases but gives them encouragement and hope in the midst of crises.
Oksana would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase the inventories. She is in the process of building her own house. She hopes to use additional income to build the house sooner and move there early even before the winter.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 43 years old and married with two children. She is based in Lagos with her family and has been a LAPO client for over three years now.Bola sells provisions, drinks and bottled water, she has been in this business for over three years but before now she sells cooked food. Due to change in their location she switch to this new business. She is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provision to sell, this she said will lead to a reduction in price thereby increasing her profit and will also enable her meet the demand of customers. She says with the increase in profit her family will be better cared for. Thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provision to sell

loans.name: Roekl Group Ii

texts.en:
This is Yeabu S., Bintu S. and Zainab K. of the Roekl Group II. They are small traders from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from Kiva partner SMT. With the help of previous loans, their businesses improved a great deal – they were able to make enough profit to repay their loan, feed their families, and support their school-going children. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan to further enhance their businesses.

Yeabu S. (pictured middle) is the leader of this group. Yeabu was born in Magburaka about 51 years ago. She is a widow with four children. She is a farmer as well as a businesswoman who sells dishes. Yeabu will invest this loan into her business.

loans.use: To invest in her dish-selling business

loans.name: Terrado Group

texts.es: El grupo “Terrado” esta representado por la señora Neuza y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, comida rápida, al servicio mecánico, a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos  y al alquiler de disfraces. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada  “Rubí”  pertenece al centro focal Villa Exaltación, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuanta con diez integrantes. Su presidenta es Maria B.. 
Varias son las actividades de negocio que tiene este grupo, como ser: venta de cosméticos por catalogo; venta de fruta; venta de muebles; confección artesanal de ropa para muñecas y otros. 
La asociación Rubí afirma quiere comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad y conseguir mayores ventas, tienen la seguridad de obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a 52-year-old married mother of six children, two of whom are currently in school. She started a fish business 30 years ago in a community market near where she lives. She prepares and serves very tasty fish and, for that reason, many people buy from her. Comfort buys her stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She supports her children from the proceeds of her business. She also depends on this income for their food, school bills and sometimes medical bills. Comfort is requesting a loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fish in order to increase her sales and income. This will help her to support her children's education and the growth of her business. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Mayira Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Mayira group. They are small-scale businesspeople from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL each to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, make more sales and generate a better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve and they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Alfred (pictured left). He was born in Magburaka and is now 35 years old. He is married with three children – two of whom are in primary school and one of whom is not yet of school-going age. Alfred sells cosmetics and has been in this business for many years now.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Sandra Mireira

texts.es: Sandra Mireira R. reside en Ciudad Arce ubicado en departamento de La Libertad. Con tan solo 25 anos Sandra ha tomado la decisión de crear su propio negocio y es así como lleva ya dos años atendiendo su tienda, Sandra vive solamente con su esposo quien es empleado y obtiene un sueldo de $150.00 US  mensuales, a pesar que llevan muchos años juntos aun no han dado el paso de tener hijos ya que desean estabilizar su economía para poder traer un hijo al mundo  por el momento Sandra está enfocada en hacer crecer su tienda, y por eso que solicita este crédito para poder surtir su negocio el cual le generara mayores ingresos
texts.en:
Sandra Mireira R. lives in the Acre City in the department of La Libertad, El Salvador. At only 25 years of age, Sandra decided to start her own business and now has two years experience tending to her store. She lives with her husband who works and earns a salary of 150 U.S. dollars a month. Although they have been together for many years, they have not taken the step to have children since they want to stabilize their finances before bringing a child into the world. At the moment, Sandra is focusing on her store, which is why she is requesting the loan so she can stock her business and thus generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Reina Leonor

texts.es: Reina Leonor G. M. 34 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque municipio de Cuscatlán. Reina vive con su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y sus dos hijos menores de edad, y estudiantes. Reina posee su negocio hace diez años es una venta de frutas y boquitas ubicada a los alrededores del Instituto Escolar Nacional de la zona, donde en su mayoría los clientes son los estudiantes, el crédito que solicita Reina es para comprar de su mercadería al por mayor, logrando de esa manera obtener un margen mayor de ganancia, lo que le permitirá mejorar la vida económica de los suyos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Rafael Alfredo

texts.es: Rafael Alfredo A. vive en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Rafael de 46 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas gemelas de 4 años de edad. Rafael se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas desde su casa, posee doce años de experiencia en su negocio, lo que hoy le permite tener una buena competencia en el mercado ya que el ofrece muy buenos precios y calidad excelente de sus productos. Rafael solicita este crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor para poder reducir sus costos y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rafael Alfredo A. lives in the municipality of Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlán, El Salvador. He is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their two twin daughters, age 4. Rafael makes a living making backpacks in his home, and he has 12 years' experience in the business, which allows him today to have a competitive edge in the marketplace since he offers very good prices and products of excellent quality. Rafael is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials at wholesale in order to reduce his costs and earn better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make backpacks

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 41 year old trader. She is married with two children. One child is currently in school whiles her last born is still under breasting. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials and has been in this business for the last eight years. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. She has amazed lots of marketing experience and she very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials with variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide for her kids with quality education to make them more resourceful in future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Cebatakolo Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Cebatakolo group. They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the very first time to enable them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting schools expenses. 

Santigie J. (left) is the leader of this group. Santigie was born in Magburaka town and he is twenty-five years old. He is single. Santigie is an Okada (motorbike) driver. He has been an Okada driver for five years now. Santigie will add some money to this loan to buy himself a new motorbike.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou N. habite a camberene et est vendeuse de cacahuettes.elle exerce cette activite depuis 1984.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 19 ans.elle sollicite un pret de cent mille(100 000)pour augmenter son fonds acheter le produit qu'elle commercialise aun prix plus competitif et ainsi maximiser ses profits.son activite lui permet d'assurer la depense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Seynabou N. lives in Camberene and is a retailer of peanuts. She has run this business since 1984. She has been a parent client for 19 years. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 FCFA to increase her capital to buy the products that she sells at a more competitive price, and thereby maximize her profits. Her business allows her to meet her daily expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital to buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es: María Josefa R. A. reside en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador junto a su único hijo quien es empleado. María  tiene una venta de variedad de carnes como pollo, res, cerdo; su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado el Matazano donde sus ventas son a diario, manteniendo una clientela estable que prefieren de las carnes que María vende ya que son de muy buena calidad; el destino del crédito que solicita María es para surtir su inventario de sus productos.
texts.en:
María Josefa R. A. lives in the municipality of Soyapango, department of San Salvador, El Salvador, along with her only son, who is employed. María sells a variety of meats, such as chicken, beef and pork, at her business located in the Matazano market. She works every day, maintaining a stable clientele that prefers her meats because of their very high quality. The loan she is requesting will be used to stock her inventory with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Try For Me Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Try for Me group. They are small-scale businesswomen from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL each for the very first time to enable them to improve the quality and size of their businesses. With a lot of goods on their stalls, they will be able to attract more customers, make more sales and increase their profits. Consequently, they will be able to look after themselves and their children better.

Marie K. (pictured right) is the leader of this group. Marie was born in a village called Yere in northern Sierra Leone. She is 35 years old, married to a businessman, and has three children. Two of Marie’s children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. Marie sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice and other locally-produced foodstuffs. She has been in this business for many years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and generate a better profit.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Deysi Guadalupe

texts.es: Deysi Guadalupe R. H. reside en Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador, vive  con madre y  su esposo Jose que trabaja como empleado ganando mensualmente $200.00 US con los que aporta a su esposa para los gastos de la casa. Deysi  maneja su propio negocio una tienda ubicada en su casa de domicilio, la tienda de Deysi es la preferida en la colonia ya que Deysi se preocupa por mantener en su negocio lo que lo clientes más demandan y también ella es una persona muy amable al atenderlos cuando llegan  a su negocio, el crédito que solicita Deysi en esta oportunidad es para compra de productos de los que carece en este momento, con la ayuda de su crédito la tienda Deysi seguirá siendo la preferida de su colonia.
texts.en:
Deysi Guadalupe R. H. lives Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her mother and her husband, Jose, who works and whose $200.00 monthly paycheck goes to support his wife and pay the household expenses. Deysi manages her own business - a store located in a residential home. Deysi's store is already a neighborhood favorite since she makes sure that her shop maintains her customers' most requested items, and she is also a very friendly person and attentive when people come into her store. The loan that Deysi is seeking would buy the products that are currently out of stock. With the help if this loan, Deysi's store will continue to be a favorite of the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to supply her store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel A. R. reside en Ilopango municipio de San Salvador. Maribel tiene 39 años de edad a pesar de solo haber cursado hasta educación básica Maribel es un ejemplo a seguir en cuanto a administrar un negocio, ya que ya mantenido a través de diez años, su negocio de Confección  con  el apoyo de su esposo Luis ha logrado distribuir ahora de sus productos en diversos lugares donde los clientes quedan satisfechos con las elaboraciones y diseños en carteras de Maribel. 
El crédito que solita en esta oportunidad es para comprar tela que le ayude a incrementar su producción al igual que sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maribel A. R. lives in the municipality of Ilopango, San Salvador, El Salvador. She is 39 years old, and despite only having a basic education she is an example of how to administer a business. For the past 10 years she has maintained her sewing business with the support of her husband, Luis, and now distributes her products to widespread locations. Her customers stay satisfied with her work and the designs of her handbags. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fabric that will help her increase her production as well as her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Mafino Group

texts.en:
Here are Rosaline T., Abibatu T., Adamsay T. and Mariatu T.. They are members of the Mafino (Goodness) group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from Kiva partner SMT. The women have been in business for many years but their businesses have developed at a very slow pace. Consequently, they have come to SMT to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL each to improve their businesses.

Rosaline T. (pictured right) is the leader of this group. Rosaline was born in Magburaka 32 years ago. She is single with two children who both attend school. Rosaline is a nurse and also a small trader. She will invest this loan in both her small pharmacy and her palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) business.

loans.use: To invest in her pharmacy, and in her palm oil business

loans.name: His Majesty Group

texts.en:
Emelia is 40 years old, and is married with one child who is currently in school. To support her household, Emelia has been selling cereals such as maize, beans and groundnuts in her neighborhood to loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative. Therefore she is requesting a loan to expand her inventory to make more income to support her family. Emelia takes delivery of stock from suppliers in the northern region of Ghana and retails to her customers. She would be grateful for your support.

Emelia (shown seated in the photograph) is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘His Majesty’. Most of the members of this group are small traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals such as groundnuts, maize and beans

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es: Jose Leonardo G. P. de 48 años de edad reside en Tocatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador junto a su  esposa y su hija. Jose ha creado su negocio con la elaboración de artesanías hechas  carteras las cuales tiene gran demanda por sus precios y su estilo único, las personas las compran mucho para regalar como un recuerdo de El Salvador. El crédito que solicita Jose es para compra de materia prima que le permita aumentar su producción en sus bonitas carteras.
texts.en:
Jose Leonardo G. P. is 48 years old and lives in Tocatepeque, departament of San Salvador, El Salvador, along with his wife and daughter. Jose has created his business making artisan-crafted handbags, which are in high demand for their price and unique style. People buy a lot of them to give as souvenirs from El Salvador. The loan Jose is requesting will be used to purchase raw materials that will allow him to increase his production of the beautiful bags.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make artisan-crafted handbags

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es: Sandra Marina A. D. M.  vive en el municipio D. Cuscatancingo del departamento D. San Salvador. Sandra vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando. Maximiliano el esposo D. Sandra es empleado y aporta al hogar $250.00 US. Sandra posee una panadería hace diez años, en la panadería se elabora todo tipo D. pan dulce el cual es distribuido en la zona, el anhelo  D. Sandra es poder sacar mayor producción D. su pan, motivo por el cual solicita este crédito con el que  Sandra pretenD. comprar materia prima que le ayuda a incrementar su producción D. pan y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Marina A. D. M. lives in the town of Cuscatancingo in the District of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and three children, who are students. Her husband, Maximiliano, is employed and brings home $250 USD.

Sandra has operated a bakery for the past 10 years. She makes all kinds of sweet breads that are distributed throughout the area.

Sandra wants to increase her bread production. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for making larger quantities of bread so that she can earn more money for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Tasuthekeh group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have benefited from previous loans from Kiva partner SMT. With these loans, they were able to expand their businesses and improve both sales and profit. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 SLL each to further strengthen their businesses. Consequently, they will be able to better support themselves and their school-going children.

Sullay K. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group. Sullay is 42 years old, and a widow with five children. Three of her children are now in secondary school and two are in primary school. Sullay sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been in this business for over 20 years. With this loan, she will be able to travel as far as neighboring Guinea to buy clothes at a cheaper rate, and retail them in Magburaka town.

loans.use: To purchase clothes at a cheaper rate in neighboring Guinea

loans.name: Marta Ofelia

texts.es: Marta Ofelia T. D. V. resiD. en Ciudad Delgado ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Marta tiene 52 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos nietos menores D. edad y estudiantes. Marta posee una tienda llamada ‘‘Bendición D. Dios’’, con diecinueve años  D. experiencia en  su negocio Marta sabe lo importante que es  la atención a su clientes es por eso que ahora Marta es D. las tiendas con mayor afluencia D. clientes diarios, Marta esta solicitando este crédito para surtir su negocio lo que le permitirá a seguir triunfando en su ventas como hasta el día D. hoy.
texts.en:
Marta Ofelia T. D. V. lives in the city of Delgado, which is located in the District of San Salvador. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 2 grandchildren, who are students. Marta owns a store called “Blessing of God”, which has been in business for 19 years. She knows the importance of taking care of her customers. For this reason, Marta’s store is one of the shops most frequently visited on a daily basis.

She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can continue to experience successful sales each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Tainratha Group

texts.en:
These people are members of the Tainrantha Group. They are (from right to left) M’Balu K., Memuna L., Abdul M., and Adamsay K. (with her small photo attached, she is a group member who was not able to be at the group meeting.  Her picture was taken during a later visit). They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town and have benefited from previous SMT loans. Previous SMT loans have made a lot of improvements in their lives and businesses. As a result of such loans, they were able to improve their businesses, make better sales and profit and consequently improve their standard of living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 4,200,000 to further strengthen their businesses.

Memuna L. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Memuna is approximately forty years of age. She was born in Lunar, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married in Magburaka town to a businessman and they have five children together. One of their children is now in college; the others are in secondary and primary schools. Memuna sells fresh fish and has been in this business for more than twenty years. With this loan, Memuna will be able to buy an additional two cartons of fresh fish. A carton of fish usually costs her Le 500,000 in Freetown.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Service Group

texts.en:
Bright is a 43-year-old father of four children who are schooling. He is very hard-working and resourceful to his family. He sells charcoal, firewood, and yams in his neighborhood.

Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Bright obtains his supply of charcoal, firewood and yams from the surrounding villages in his community, where he lives, and retails them to his customers. With his two years' business and sales experience, he wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply to increase his inventory. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase savings to pay for the children’s educational fees.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Service’. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal, firewood and yams

loans.name: Top-Up Sellers Group

texts.en:
These people are Salieu M. S., Alhaji K., and Zainab B.. They named their group Top-Up Seller, named after the group leader’s business. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They have been in business for years now but business has been growing at a very slow pace. So, they have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them develop their businesses.

Salieu (left) is the leader of this group. Salieu is now twenty-nine years old, born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and together they have a six-year-old child. Salieu has been a businessman for five years now. He sells top-up cards for all four GSM mobile networks in the country. He also sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories, and he recharges mobile batteries for a fee of Le 1,000. With this loan, he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is married and has two children. He has been through senior high school. John sells wood at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2001.  John uses his income to pay his dependents' school fees and utility bills. John will use the loan to purchase more wood, especially plywood for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood especially plywood for sale

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer is 34 years old he is married and father of four children. He is a dealer in mobile phones, phones housing, video discs, DVD player and accessories. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phone and DVD players has become very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication. He buys his supplies from Togo at wholesale prices and gives to his customers at retail prices. He requests for the loan to enable him procure increased stock of Mobile phone, DVD players and phone accessories. He hopes the loan would enable him to increase savings to expand his showcase. With the loan he believes he can buy assorted phones so that his customers can make a choice from them. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio
