texts.es: José R. nació el 16 de septiembre de 1,942 en santa Catarina Pinula tiene 5 hijos 4 ya están casados y el menor de 13 años vive con el y estudia, el casado tiene 18 años con una pequeña maquila en la cual tenia 12 personas trabajando sacaba 70 docenas diarias de blusas cerro su negocio por que viajo a los estados unidos  al regreso inicio su empresa de taxis y tiene 8 años de tenerla actualmente tiene 4 taxis y tiene 3 chóferes su ingreso diario es de Q 1,000.00 a la semana por cada taxi también tiene una paca, en la cual quiere invertir con el préstamo.
texts.en:
José R. was born on September 16, 1942, in Santa Catarina Pinula. He is married and has five children. Four of his children are married, while the youngest is a 13 year old student.

For 18 years, Sr. José operated a small import-export business in which he had 12 employees producing 70 dozen blouses each day. He closed the business so that he could travel to the United States. When he returned, he started a taxi business that has been in operation for 8 years. At the moment, he has 4 taxis and 3 drivers who are paid daily and generate weekly revenue of 1000 GTQ per taxi.

Sr. José also owns a wholesale clothing store in which he will invest this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.es: Andrea se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado todos los días, y los días de mercado de donde es originaria de San Martín Jilotepeque, tiene un  comedor y en su casa tiene una venta de pollo, es una mujer emprendedora porque le gusta el comercio tiene su clientela ella prepara variedad de comidas, tiene 7 hijos casados la mas pequeña le ayuda a atender el negocio que es la venta de pollo porque esta ubicado en su casa le da gracias a Dios porque tiene ganancias lo que le ha servido para volver a invertirlo en su negocio a ella le gusta ser responsable en sus pagos, su sueño es tener una bonita casa y también ver su negocio con mas clientela y mas variedad de comidas
texts.en:
Andrea sells food every day in the market. "Market Days" is a concept that originated in San Martín Jilotepeque. She also operates a dining hall in her home where she sells chicken. This entrepreneur enjoys her business because she gets to prepare a variety of dishes for her customers.

Andrea is married and has 7 children. The youngest child tends to the business that sells chicken because it is located at home. She thanks God that she has income to reinvest into her business. She also likes being responsible with her payments.

Andrea dreams of having a beautiful home and seeing her businesses attract more clients and offer a greater variety of dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her food businesses

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina Cabrieles es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad dos hijas a las cuales quiere darle lo mejor. 
Sus niñas ya van a entrar a estudiar la secundaria, pero tiene un problema que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción y comprar le los uniformes.
Es por eso que solicita un crédito y así poder darles es estudio a sus hijas.
Doña Saturnina trabaja como maestra de ciencias y química en una escuela particular eso son los ingresos que genera pasa sus hijas y con el cual una parte será para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Saturnina Cabrieles is a single mother. She is responsible for her two daughters, for whom she wants to provide the best.

Her daughters are about to start high school, but she is experiencing difficulties at the moment because she lacks the necessary funds to pay for their registration and school uniforms.

She is requesting a loan so that she can give her daughters a chance to study. Doña Saturnina teaches science and chemistry at a private school. Her income goes to support her daughters, but a portion will be set aside to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughters' school uniforms & registration fees

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Doris, es una mujer trabajadora y Luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas y así hacer profesionales a sus hijos, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

Doris, poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio.
Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. 
En su negocio, sus clientes encuentra lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región y de otras partes del país, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Doris, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse en lo como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “San Marcello II”, which is located the District of Morales, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 dependent children.

Doris is a hard worker and a fighter. She feels she can continue to press forward so that her children can become professionals. She is very pleased with what she has already accomplished. Doris sells fruits and vegetables. Sales have been very good since she is well-known among her customers.

Saving little by little over time, Doris decided to start her own business. She continues to invest in her business in the same manner. She enjoys what she does, but she is in business primarily to support her children. Her customers visit her in order to purchase items needed to make salads or juices. She greets all of her customers personally with a smile.

Doris will use her loan of 1000 soles to buy bags of oranges, tangerines, citrons, taperebá (a native fruit of the Amazon region), and other varieties of fruits from the region and different parts of the country so that she can provide better service to her customers and give them what they need.

Doris says that she has been able to complete some of the goals she set for herself. Thanks to the help of Manuela Ramos, she was able to start her business and develop personally as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase regional fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es: José Emilio de 50 años de edad se dedica a la confección de trajes de caballeros tiene bastante experiencia hace 30años lo aprendió con su padre tiene 5 hijos, uno de sus hijos lo apoya cuando tiene demanda y pedidos, este muchacho estudia en sus tiempos libres colabora a confeccionar prendas porque ya aprendió a coser pantalones formales de vestir, don Emilio necesita dinero para invertir y comprar telas y otros materiales de sastrería el trabajo que hace es muy reconocido por todo el pueblo de San Martín Jilotepeque que donde el tiene el negocio su sueño es ampliar su negocio y que pueda ofrecer producto de calidad para su clientela pero debe tener mostrarios en diferentes telas y materiales su esposa es de ayuda cuando hay necesidad también se involucra a cose dichas prendas o colocarles botones donde haya necesidad.

loans.use: Compra de material para elaboracion de trajes

loans.name: Keli

texts.es:
La señora Keli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y no tiene hijos.

Keli, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de refrigerios, hoy en día vende productos de catálogos de las diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Kelita, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Keli belongs to the Communal Bank "San Marcelo II" in the Morales District in the San Martín Province of Peru. She is a common-law wife, is 29 years old, and doesn't have children. Keli is a woman who has managed to get past many difficulties in her life and her desire to get ahead gave her good results. Before, she worked selling snacks, and today she sells catalog products from different lines such as: Unique, Esika, and Avon, and she is very happy about what she has achieved. With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will buy beauty products for her stock, like women's and men's perfumes, lotions, compact powders, lip liners, nail polish, as well as another display case to show her products in. With her maturity, Kelita is an example to follow for many women who start a business and achieve their goals with perseverance. She is very thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and helping other women grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy catalog products to increase her stock

loans.name: Libna

texts.es:
La señora Libna, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 05 hijos,  01 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Libna, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en el patio de su casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y al frente de su casa, se encuentra una maderera, donde sus principales clientes son los mismos trabajadores. Ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 9:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

loans.name: María Lus

texts.es:
La señora María Lus, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

Hoy en día también se dedica a venta de anticuchos, donde trabaja a partir de las 5:30 pm. y atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará abarrotes como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, paquetes de aceites y leches e insumos como: arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.

María Lus, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora María Lus belongs to the San Marcelo II Communal Bank in the District of Morales, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 39 years old and married with three children, all of whom are dependent on her. Her fighting spirit, which has always characterized her, and her desire to get ahead on her own have led her to start her own business selling groceries. It is located in a place which is well equipped and where there is lots of traffic, and little by little she has been making herself well-known among her customers and now, she tells us, things are going quite well for her in this business. At present she is also selling kebabs, from 5:30 pm on, and she tends to her customers with her usual and characteristic charisma. With this loan of 500 Sols she will buy groceries, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, packages of oil and milk; and ingredients, such as rice, eggs and Peruvian chickens for her Juanes (a mixture of rice, chicken, eggs, olives, and spices, wrapped in "bijao" plant leaf), as well as cooking utensils to provide quality service and to replace the old ones. María Lus feels calm and satisfied with what she is doing and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to expand her inventory and ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teres De Jesús L. tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quienes están actual mente estudiando.
Doña Teresa De Jesús es empleada de una fábrica en el departamento de producción, su sueldo es bajo y no puede cubrir la inscripción de la escuela de sus hijos. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder pagar a la escuela para que sus niños puedan estudiar esté año.
También planes poner un pequeño negocio de venta de tacos hay en su casa y así poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Teresa De Jesús L. has two children who are currently students. She works in the production department of a factory. Her salary is low and she cannot cover her children's school registration fees. For this reason she is requesting a loan and in this way will be able to pay the school so that her children can attend this year. She also plans on putting a small business at her house selling tacos and thereby will be able to give the best to her children and pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Henry Armando

texts.es:
Henry tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos de 15 y de 2 años en el anexo Ciudad de Dios, que se ubica en la carretera Chiclayo – San José, a 10 minutos de la ciudad.

Tiene un pequeño puesto en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el que vende sandalias desde hace tres años, las compra en la frontera con Ecuador para luego vendérselas a sus clientes a 10 nuevos soles; anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio de frutas en ese mismo puesto pero, como dicho negocio no le resultaba rentable, decidió incursionar en el negocio de venta de sandalias.

Su actividad es la única que brinda a su familia los recursos económicos diarios, por lo que mantener su puesto y a su clientela resulta crucial para él, todos los dias trabaja con valentía y optimismo y su esfuerzo, poco a poco, esta dando resultados.

Henry desea brindarle a su hijo mayor un mejor futuro, el ya esta terminando su educación secundaria y su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle algun tipo de educación superior, debido a ello el desea invertir en la compra de más mercadería (sandalias) para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo cual está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El lleva ya mas de tres años trabajando con nosotros y ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos por lo que es considerado como un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Henry is 40 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children of ages 15 and 2. They live in the suburb of Ciudad de Dios, which is located on the road to Chiclayo – San José, ten minutes away from the city (Chiclayo).

He has a small booth in the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo, where he’s been selling sandals for three years. He buys the sandals at the border with Eduador and sells them to his customers for 10 nuevos soles. Previously, he used to sell fruits in the same booth, but it wasn’t profitable. He decided to switch to sell sandals instead.

His business is the only income his family counts on for their daily needs, which makes it crucial for him to keep his business going. Every day he goes into work with a lot of courage and optimism, and his efforts are slowly paying off.

Henry wants to give his older son a better future. He is about to finish high school and Henry would like for him to get a higher education. To accomplish this, Henry would like to purchase more sandals for resale. He is requesting a loan of $700 (2000 nuevos soles) to help him reach his objective.

Henry has been working with Edpyme (micro-finance institution) for over three years. He has proven to be responsible and timely with his payments, which makes him an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale sandals for resale

loans.name: Rosa Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Graciela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 54 años y todos sus hijos ya independientes.

Rosa Graciela, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y chichas (bebida hecha a base de harina de maíz). Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto y asi poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes de su barrio y de otros lugares.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como: harina de maíz, azúcar y clavo de olor, para dar un rico sabor a sus bebidas.
 
Rosa Graciela, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “San Marcello II”, which is located the District of Morales, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old and single. All of her children live on their own.

Rosa Graciela is woman who enjoys working, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks and chicha (a drink made from cornmeal). When it comes to managing her business, she doesn’t follow a set schedule and she is her own boss. She tells us that she started with 300 soles to buy 3 packs of sodas. She did very well, so she gradually invested more into her business.

Her business continues to operate and she is well-known by her customers in the neighborhood and from elsewhere. With her loan of 1000 soles, Rosa Graciela will buy more beverages such as sodas of different flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as mineral water (both carbonated and non-carbonated). She will also use some of the money to buy ingredients such as cornmeal, sugar, and cloves to give a rich flavor to her beverages.

Rosa Graciela has many goals ahead of her and she is motivated to meet every one of them. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing help when she needed it. She has been responsible with her payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Click HERE to view Rosa Graciela’s previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & ingredients for making "chicha"

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El señor Fidencio V. tiene ya más de 15 años a  su negocio de papelería y abarrotes, esté negocio y su empleo como maestro de físico – química es el ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo.
 Desea invertir mas en la papelería con el regreso a clases tiene muy buenas ventas y con eso nuevo ingreso pagara el préstamo.

loans.use: Comprar mecánica para el negocio

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa V. está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia D. un terreno y empezar la construcción D. su vivienda. 
Actual mente está viviendo en casa D. su suegra pero ya está creciendo la familia y quieren tener su propia casa. 
Ella trabaja en un salón D. belleza como estilista y su esposo el señor Delfino Pérez es empleado D. una compañía D. trasportes es un chofer D. carga, estos son los ingresos que tiene para darle lo mejor a su familia y con el cual piensan pagar el crédito. 
Porque desean ya tener su propio patrimonio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Teresa V. is requesting a loan in order to make the down payment on a piece of land so that she can start the construction of her house. At the moment, she is living in the home of her mother-in-law. Her family is already growing and they need to have their own home.

Sra. María works in a beauty salon as a stylist. Her husband, Sr. Delfino Pérez, is employed by a company as a truck driver. With their incomes, they hope to proviD. the best for their family and be able to repay the loan. They hope to have something that they can leave to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Down payment on a piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mecánica para el negocio

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 42 years old and married with 4 children, he mould and sells blocks. He is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase one more moulding machine. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one more molding machine

loans.name: Owolabi

texts.en: Owolabi is 58 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. He buys old cars and repairs their body and engine and sells them to make profit.  He is a panel beater and mechanic by profession. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase a used car and materials to repair it for sale.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a used car and materials to repair it

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 48 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. He sells engine oil and also phone chargeable batteries. He is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell.  He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín es un joven trabajador de 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años de manera independiente, cultiva la papa y la vende directamente a los mercados de la ciudad más cercana a su zona. También tiene ganado vacuno que le sirven para el arado, los cuales arrienda sus vecinos agricultores para obtener ingresos extras. El trabajo que realiza es diario, llegando por la noche agotado, sin embargo es un trabajo que disfruta porque es su propio negocio. El sueño de Efraín es ser un gran ganadero y agricultor que pueda producir a gran escala los productos de su tierra. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los integrantes más activos de su banco comunal y su responsabilidad se destaca en su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de sacos de abono y guano para preparar sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 42 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for the past 16 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Bolatito

texts.en: Bolatito is 32 years old and married with a child. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for the past 7 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo tiene 28 años, vive con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 6 años en su casa propia. Hace 7 años, además de su actividad ganadera, decidió vender alfalfa y papa, las cuales cultiva en sus propios terrenos. Todos los días sale al campo para llevar a sus vacas a pastear, posteriormente verifica el estado de sus plantaciones para evitar el avance de plagas o enfermedades que puedan perjudicar sus cosechas, así se asegura de que sus ganancias sean satisfactorias. Esta forma de trabajo le da buenos resultados para solventar los gastos familiares, por tal motivo, para más adelante, Gerardo piensa implementarse con mejores herramientas e intensificar su producción de alfalfa y su actividad ganadera. Esta es su cuarta oportunidad de crédito con MFP, él es uno de los socios más antiguos de su banco comunal y su responsabilidad es reconocida por los demás integrantes, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a seguir trabajando por el bienestar común. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de abono, semilla y una vaquilla.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 28 years old. He lives with his parents and his 6 year old son in their own home. Seven years ago, in addition to raising livestock, he decided to sell alfalfa and potatoes that he grows on his own land. Every day he allows his cattle to graze and then checks the status of his crops to prevent the development of pests and diseases. These precautionary steps ensure that his earnings remain satisfactory. Through his hard work, he hopes to see good results in order to satisfy his household expenses.

In the future, Gerardo woud like to invest in better tools so that he can increase his alfalfa production and livestock breeding. He is requesting his fourth loan from MFP. He is one of the long-time members of his Communal Bank and his responsibility has been recognized by the rest of the group. He has committed once again to continue working for the common good. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and a heifer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, seeds, and a heifer

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer fuerte y valiente, tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Ya son 20 años de ardua labor agrícola, la cual realiza junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ellos cultivan principalmente la papa y también crían ganado ovino y otros animales menores como los cuyes, los cuales mantiene en su casa. Todas las mañanas sale a pastear a sus animales durante largas caminatas que duran horas, debido a la distancia de los pastizales adecuados para que sus animales estén bien alimentados. Pasados 6 meses aproximadamente las tareas se intensifican, ya que la cosecha o la siembra requieren de mayor esfuerzo físico. Pero mientras tanto, Julia sale a vender los cuyes que tiene en su granja y de esa manera responder a las necesidades urgentes que se presentan en el hogar. Durante todos estos años sus cosechas le han proporcionado ganancias variables, pese a eso, el sustento familiar se mantiene y por esta razón Julia planifica para el futuro en seguir luchando por tener mejores cosechas. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su perseverancia en formar parte de su banco comunal le ha permitido ser reconocida como una de las integrantes más solidarias y se compromete a seguir  con esta buena actitud. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de ovejas y abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Julia is a strong and brave woman. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. For 20 years, she has engaged in arduous farm labor along with her family. They primarily grow potatoes, but also raise sheep and other small animals such as guinea pigs. Every morning they allow their animals to graze during their long walks that can last for hours because of the expanse of their pastures. Once six months have passed after the planting of their potato crops, the activities involved with the harvest begin to intensify because a lot more physical work is required. In the meantime, Julia sells guinea pigs in response to urgent needs that arise at home.

In previous years, their crops have provided variable gains. Despite these difficulties, Julia has been able to support her family and continues to fight so that she can have better harvests.

Julia is requesting her fourth loan from MFP. Her perseverance and participation in her Communal Bank have enabled her to become recognized as one of the most supportive members of her group. She pledges to continue with a good attitude. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase heads of sheep and fertilizer for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer & heads of sheep

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor” (Women Towards a Better Future) has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past year. “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor” currently has 10 members, all of whom live in and around the city of Pucallpa. Though some of the 13 original members had some difficulties in their previous loan cycle, the communal bank collectively overcame its problems and its current members are now eager to receive their next loan.

The women of “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor” dedicate themselves to a variety of different business ventures. Many of them have small home-based restaurants and/or sell barbecued meats. Others sell vegetables, fish, chicken or basic grocery items. They are requesting a total loan amount of 3800 soles, and each will invest her share in her business. Each member is gradually working toward achieving her business goals.

Señora Nelly M. is the official president of “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor.” She is 52 years old and is married with two adult children, aged 28 and 24. Nelly works together with her husband in a fish sales business and plans to invest her loan in purchasing ice and coolers to store her product. Nelly buys her fish in the small agricultural and fishing communities along the banks of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.

loans.use: Inputs necessary for the individual businesses of each communal bank member

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es: Nolberta es una agricultora de 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ya tiene 6 años de arduo trabajo en las tareas del campo, cultiva principalmente el tubérculo nativo de su zona que es la papa, la cual después de 6 meses de espera la vende en los principales mercados de abastos de las ciudades más aledañas de su localidad. Paralelamente a esta actividad Nolberta cría animales, los cuales vende y también son para su propio consumo. Todos los miembros de su familia realizan estas tareas, así reducen los gastos de contratar a peones para la siembra o cosecha. A pesar de los momentos de dificultades, su sentido de perseverancia la ha llevado mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas cada vez más, fortaleciendo la calidad de la tierra, y también para incrementar su ganado vacuno. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por ello Nolberta confía en seguir realizando un trabajo responsable, solidario y honesto en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará sacos de abono, fertilizantes y ganado ovino.
texts.en:
Nolberta is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For the past six years, she has been engaged in arduous work cultivating potatoes that are native to this area. Once the crops are planted, she must wait six months before she can sell her harvest in the major markets that supply the surrounding cities. At the same time, Nolberta breeds animals for sale and for personal consumption. All of her family members perform work around their farm, which reduces their costs of hiring laborers for planting and harvesting. Even though she has experienced difficult times, Nolberta’s perseverance has helped to improve the quality of her crops, the productivity from her land, and the size of her cattle herds.

This is the third time Nolberta has requested a loan from MFP. She pledges to continue working responsibly, as well as being honest and supportive of her fellow Communal Bank members. The money she requested will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer and heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer & heads of sheep

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 22 años se dedica a L. crianza D. ganado porcino y ovino y al cultivo D. papa. Todos los días trabaja alimentando a sus animales y limpiando sus establos para mantenerlos saludables. Asimismo, periódicamente revisa sus extensiones D. terreno y observa que sus plantaciones estén libres D. plagas. Durantes todos estos años su experiencia le ha permitido prevenir las enfermedades D. sus animales y D. sus plantas, para así mejorar su producción. D. esta forma sus ventas en los mercados D. L. ciudad y las ferias ganaderas son más satisfactorias. El trabajo que realiza lo hace junto a su familia y eso L. hace sentir muy contenta. Esta es L. cuarta oportunidad que tiene para un crédito con MFP, elL. es una socia muy comprometida con su banco comunal y nuevamente renueva su compromiso con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando le servirá para L. compra D. sacos D. abono y ganado ovino.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. Since she was 22 years old, she has spent her time raising pigs and sheep as well as growing potatoes. Every day she feeds her animals and cleans the stables in order to keep them healthy. At the same time, she oversees her tracts of land to determine that her crops are free of pests. Over the years, her experience has enabled her to prevent disease in her animals and crops and improve her production. Rosalía happens to find selling her products in the city markets and at livestock fairs more satisfying. She is the happiest in knowing that she gets to work alongsiD. her family.

Rosalía is taking her 4th loan with MFP. She is a very committed member of her Communal Bank and has renewed her commitment to the group. The money she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer and heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer & heads of sheep

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He sells sarongs. Kazeem lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Elena Gerenarda

texts.es:
la sra. ELENA GERENARDA M. A. tiene 10 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de productos naturales, vende una gran variedad de productos como ser: Cremas, 
desodorantes, jabones, pastas dentales, vitaminas, etc…
Elena vende el producto de manera ambulante en diferentes colonias de la ciudad de Danlí.- 
Es casada y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales todos dependen del matrimonio.
su esposo es ingeniero agronomo y presta sus servicios como facilitador, juntos cubren los gastos de educación, alimentación, salud y vestuario para sus hijos.
con los ingresos que tiene doña elena de su negocio, cubre sus compromisos fianancieros y sus gastos
personales.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena Gerenarda M. A. has 10 years of business experience. She sells a variety of natural products including crèmes, deodorants, soaps, toothpastes, vitamins, etc. She sells her products door-to-door in different neighborhoods within the city of Danlí.

She is married and the mother of 4 dependent children. Her husband is an agricultural engineer and offers his services as a consultant. Together they cover the cost of feeding, educating, clothing, and providing health care for their children. With the earnings from her business, Doña Elena is able to meet her financial commitments and personal expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ayobola

texts.en: Ayobola is 37 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. She sells sarongs. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell so that she meets the demand from the increasing number of her customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Rosa es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Rosa alquila su casa como playa de estacionamiento, en donde también funciona un terminal terrestre el cual es administrado por ella, también alquila servicios higiénicos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de utensilios de limpieza y para el pintado de su casa.
Los sueños de Rosa son tener otro terminal e implementar un cafetín en cu casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Bonanza Communal Bank. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children.

Rosa rents out the property around her home as a parking lot, which also contains a bus depot that she manages. She also has public lavatory facilities for rent.

Rosa needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase cleaning supplies and utensils for painting her home. She dreams of having another terminal and opening a small café in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning supplies & painting utensils

loans.name: Obras Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma B. D. T. actualmente asume el cargo D. Prsidenta del Grupo Obras.  Ella se dedica ala confección D. ropa y disfraces nos cuenta que empezó esta labor realizando disfraces para niños D. la escuela inicial y para lograr clientela ella asistía a diferentes colegios D. su localidad en el Callao con el fin D. ofrecer sus servicios, ala par también hacia trabajos para una casa D. novios, pero poco a poco decidió seguir con su negocio propio D. alquiler D. disfraces hasta lograr hacerse conocida, actualmente tiene su propio taller D. confecciones al cual se dedica a tiempo completo, D. esta manera ayuda a su esposo que trabaja en el servicio D.  taxi. ambos apoyan a sus 3  hijos en su educación universitaria,la señora norma también esta incursionando en otro negocio q es la venta D. atún la cual realiza los días sábados y domingos en el mercado,ella siente que poco a poco esta alcanzando sus objetivos uno D. ellos es terminar D. construir su casa y ponerla como ella dice “muy linda” y con el préstamo D. EDAPROSPO seguirá invirtiendo en su negocio D. esta manera podrá seguir creciendo y produciendo lo q la hace muy feliz.
La Señora Norma aparece muy sonriente sentada entre todas sus compañeras del grupo OBRAS
texts.en:
Sra. Norma B. D. T. is the president of the Grupo Obras. She is in the business of making clothing and costumes. She tells us that she initially began making costumes for school children, and in order to obtain clients, she attended different high schools in her town of Callao to offer her services. She also did work for a bridal store, but little by little she decided to continue with her own business of renting costumes, until she succeeded in making herself well known. Currently she has her own tailoring shop which she is dedicated to full-time. This way, she helps her husband who works as a taxi driver. Together they both support their three children in their university education. Sra. Norma is also venturing into another business, which is the sale of tuna, which she does on Saturdays and Sundays in the market. She feels that little by little she is reaching her goals, one of which is to finish building her house, and to make it, as she says "very pretty". With this loan from EDAPROSPO, she will continue investing in her business, so that she will be able to continue growing and producing that which makes her very happy. *Sra. Norma appears very cheerful seated amongst all of her OBRAS group colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue setting up her costume store

loans.name: Analda Josefa

texts.es:
La sra. Analda R. tiene 50 años de edad, es comerciante y su actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de tajaditas de platano fritas, las vende en los diferentes institutos y escuelas de la ciudad, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, dicha actividad le genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia y demas compromisos que tiene.
Analda esta solicitando este credito para el complemento de compra de una motocicleta, ya que su 
producto lo distribuye de manera ambulante haciendo uso de una bicicleta.
tiene la colaboracion de su hijo para repartir su producto.
ella considera que es necesario la compra de motocicleta para poder realizar las entregas mas rapido.
ya que por el tiempo que se demora en entregar no puede repartir mas bolsas de tajaditas.
texts.en:
Sra. Analda R. is 50 years old. She is an entrepreneur who makes and sells plantain chips. She sells her product to various institutions and schools throughout the city. Sra. Analda has been in business for 5 years and says that she is able to generate enough income to cover her family expenses and other financial commitments.

She is requesting a loan in order to complete the purchase of a motorcycle. Her son currently distributes her products door-to-door on a bicycle. Sra. Analda believes having a motorcycle is necessary in order to make faster deliveries. With the time it currently takes to make deliveries, she is not able to distribute all of her inventory of chips.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making plantain chips & a motorbike for making deliveries

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olukemi

texts.en: Olukemi is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She has a provision shop and has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provision to sell so that she meet up with the increasing number of her customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provision to sell

loans.name: Olayiwola

texts.en: Olayiwola is 36 years old and married with a child. She has a shop where she sells medicine. She has been in this business for the past 18 years. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medical drugs to sell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Basirat

texts.en: Basirat is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells engine oil. Basirat has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Juana es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
Juana sueña con mejorar y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Bonanza Communal Bank. She is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a shop in her home where she sells groceries. Juana manages her business every day with the help of her son.

She needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy rice and sugar. Juana dreams of improving and expanding her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Serif

texts.en: Serif is 31 years old and married with a child who is in school. He sells motor spare parts. He is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell so that he can meet the demand of his increasing number of customers and make more profit.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She has a salon and also sells cosmetics. She is requesting for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase generator as alternative power supply and deep freezer for sales of cool drinks so that she meet up with the increasing number of her customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase generator and deep freezer for business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 55 years old and a widow with six children. She sells building materials and is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase additional building materials to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional building materials to sell

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Teodosia es viuda, tiene 49 años y 7 hijos, Teodosia vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Teodosia son tener una tienda en su casa e implementar una zapatería para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Community Bank Bonanza. She is 49 years old, widow and has seven children. She sells firewood from her home. With her son’s help, she buys the firewood from the producers.

Teodosia is requesting a loan of $700 (2000 soles), which will be invested in purchasing more firewood. She dreams of having her own store at home and creating a footwear store for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Women Of The Valley Group

texts.es:
el grupo Mujeres del Valle esta integrado por 4 mujeres muy luchadoras, a continuacion se detalla las actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. LEYLA DEL CARMEN M. tiene 4 años de haber iniciado la venta de cosmeticos, la mayoria de sus ventas las lleva a cabo de manera ambulante.- Leyla tomo la desición de dedicarse al comercio para apoyar a su esposo a cubrir en lo que pueda con ciertos gastos del hogar.
Leyla vive en unión libre y es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales dependen de ella y su compañero de hogar.
su prometido se dedica a la agricultura y tambien se dedica a trabajar como labrador en el campo.

la sra. NEYBI SOFIA R. O. tiene 1 año de haber iniciado con la venta de cosmeticos,
vende el producto de manera ambulante en la aldea de Santa Maria, Jamastran.- 
Neybi vivia en unión libre y es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales ya solo 3 dependen de ella; su compañero de hogar tuvo que emigrar para los EE.UU en busca de mejorar su condición de vida y hasta el momento ha logrado, porque con las remesas que el le envia las invierte en mejorar su vivienda,  
de las ganancias que le genera su negocio cubre a un 100% los gastos personales.

la sra. JULIA AMPARO O. tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de comidas, sus clientes permanentes son los agentes policiales, Julia tomo la desición de dedicarse a esta actividad ya que anteriormente contiguo a su casa habia un comedor con atención para todo el público, pero hace 8 años este negocio fue cerrado y mucha gente tenia la costumbre de ir a comer ahi y eso le facilito el poner su negocio ya que practicamente tenia varios clientes fijos.- 
desde entonces doña Julia le vende la comida a los policias.- 
es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, de ellos dependen 4 hijas mismas que le ayudan 
a la elaboración de comidas.

la sra. YOLANDA MARIBEL M. tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan y de golosinas, Yolanda se dedica a hornear 2 veces por semana y la venta de golosinas la lleva a cabo los dias domingos, se va vender las golosinas al campo de futbol.- 
Es madre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos, su esposo labora como labrador en el campo.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella a podido apoyar a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.

todas ellas necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Women of the Valley Group (el grupo Mujeres del Valle) is comprised of four women who are strong fighters. What follows are details of the activities they have achieved. Ms. LEYLA DEL CARMEN M. has been selling cosmetics for four years. She carries out the majority of those sells on the street. Leyla decided to go into business to support her companion in covering some of their family expenses. Leyla lives with her partner and has 3 children who depend on her. Her fiance works in agriculture and works as a laborer in the fields. Mrs. NEYBI SOFIA R. O. has been selling cosmetics for 1 year. She sells cosmetics on the street in her village of Santa Maria, Jamastranh. Neybi is a mother of 4 children, 3 of whom depend on her still. Her companion had to immigrate to the USA in search of a better living, and up until now he has achieved it. With the earnings he sends home to her, she has been able to invest in improving their living conditions. From the earnings her business has generated, she is able to cover 100% of her personal expenses. Mrs. JULIA AMPARO O. has been selling food for 8 years. Her regular clients are policemen. Julia made the decision to do this business because next to her house is a dining room open to everyone. But 8 years ago this business was closed and a lot of people had been going there to eat regularly. This made putting the business there a good idea since she practically had permanent customers. Since that time, Mrs. Julia has been selling food to the policemen. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. Their four at-home daughters also work to prepare the meals. Mrs. YOLANDA MARIBEL M. has been selling bread and candy for 4 years. Yolanda bakes twice a week and sells her candy on Sundays. She’s sells the candy at the soccer fields. She is a mother of 3 children who depend on her 100%. Her husband works in the fields. With the earnings generated by her business, she has been able to support her husband in covering certain family expenses. All these families need the loans to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of creams, deorderants, disinfectants, eye shadows, lotions, lipstick, shines, powders, corn, beans, chicken, beef and pork, sausages, lard, eggs,  rice, butter, cheese, sugar, spaghetti, pastas, flour, salsas, soda.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Alejandra es viuda, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Alejandra viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que vende en el mercado Nery García, además Alejandra tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa negocio que ayuda con la ayuda de su hija.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo y arroz.
Los sueños de Alejandra son surtir su tienda y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of Bonanza community bank. She is a widow, 54 years old, and has 5 children. Alejandra travels to different street markets in the region where she buys grains, then sells the products in the Nery García market. She also has a grocery store in her house that she runs with the help of her daughter. Alejandra needs a loan of 1,050 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, pasta, and rice. Her dream is to better stock her store and bring up her children well.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, pasta, and rice.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Maura es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maura se dedica a la siembra de papa en sus terreno, además compra de los productores, producto que luego de acopiar lo envía a la ciudad de Lima con carros alquilado. Además Maura tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Maura necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Maura son mejorar sus negocios y educar a sus hijos para que triunfen en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank. She's 40-years-old, and has a common law husband and 4 children. She earns her living growing potatoes on her land, buying potatoes from other farmers, and then, once she has enough, sending the produce to Lima in rented vehicles. She also has a grocery stO. in her house. Maura is seeking a loan for 3000 soles to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams include improving her business and educating her children so they can have a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Simiatu

texts.en: Simiatu is 65 years old and married with six children. She sells motorcycle parts and is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase additional motorcycle parts to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Dina Felicitas

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Dina es conviviente, tiene 31años y 3 hijos, Dina viaja a la comunidad de Sachabamba de donde compra quesos y luego los comercializa por mayor en el mercado Santa Clara.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Dina son tener una tienda y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank. She's 31, and has a common law husband and three children. She travels to the community of Sachabamba to buy cheese, which she then sells wholesale at the Santa Clara market. Dina needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she'll use to purchase cheese. She dreams of having her own store and improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Irene es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Irene se dedica a la siembra de papa, producto que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Irene se dedica a la crianza de animales.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono para la siembra de papa.
Los sueños de Irene son construir su casa, educar a sus hijos y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Irene belongs to the Bonanza Village Bank. She is 42-years-old, and married with four children. She earns her living growing potatoes, which she sells at the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. She also raises animals. Irene is seeking a loan of 1200 soles, which she'll use to buy fertilizers for growing potatoes. She dreams of building her house, educating her children, and buying a car.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 32 years old and married with five children. She sells motor spare parts and engine oil. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more motor spare parts and engine oil to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional motor spare parts and engine oil to sell

loans.name: Ventura De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra, Ventura de Jesus P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de pulperia P.,  tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de 
actividad y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
ella es casada en la foto del negocio sale con su querido esposo.
la sra ventura esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para invertirla en su negocio, ya que tiene muchos clientes y desea satisfacer las necesidades de todos ellos.
ella desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida. tiene pensado en un futuro inviertir en mejorar y ampliar su vivienda.
se siente muy alegre por el apoyo que todos sus clientes le han dado.
texts.en:
Ventura de Jesus P. earns her living selling popular consumer products. She has a store called P.. She's been in business for a number of years, and it's worth noting that during this time she has learned how to be a manager. She is married, and in the picture above she's shown in the store with her beloved husband. Ventura is seeking a loan to invest in more merchandise for her store. She has a lot of customers and wants to meet everyone's needs. She would like to improve her quality of life. In the future she plans to invest in improving and expanding her house. She feels very glad for support her customers have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lard, rice, churros (sweet-cream-filled pastries), soft drinks, bread, cookies, coffee, tortillas, milk, chicken, soups, pastas, salsas, candies, lozenges, chocolate, toilet paper, paper towels, soaps, detergents, and juices.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es:
Guillerma es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Guillerma es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Guillerma tiene un puesto en el mercadillo de la ciudad de Quinua en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Guillerma junto a su esposo hacen leña.
Guillerma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Guillerma son mejorar su negocio y que su hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Guillerma is a member of the Winarisun Community Bank. In Quechua, Winarisun means 'May We Grow'. Guillerma is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She has a stall in the large market in the City of Quinua where she sells meat every day. In addition, she and her husband make fire-wood.

Guillerma needs a loan of $350 to buy hogs. Her dreams are to better her business and to have her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY HOGS

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Teodora es casada, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Teodora tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende carne actividad que realiza todos los días, los animales los adquiere en las ferias de la región.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdo y ovino.
Los sueños de Teodora son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de cerdo y ovino.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Karina es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Karina viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, producto que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe.
Los sueños de Karina con tener una tienda de ropa y surtir con mas productos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank which means “Let’s Grow” in Quechua. Karina is a common-law wife, 23 years old with 1 child. Karina travels to regional markets where she sells a variety of clothing acquired in the city of Lima. Karina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to buy baby clothing. Karina’s dream is to have a clothing store, stocked with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby clothing

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Catalina es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Catalina tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias de la región, además Catalina tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovino y cerdo.
Los sueños de Catalina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovino y cerdo.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.es:
Evelina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Evelina es soltera, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Evelina vive en el distrito de Quinua en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo menor.
Evelina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un terreno para su casa.
Evelina sueña con construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Evelina is a member of the Wiñarisun Village Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in the Quechua language. She is 42, single, and has three children. She lives in the Quinua district, where she sells food on a daily basis with the help of her youngest child. Evelina needs a loan for 1000 soles, which she'll use as partial payment on a lot for her house. She dreams of building her house and having a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As partial payment on a lot for her house.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Gloria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado llamado Las Tejas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 2 personas. Además Gloria cría cuy en su casa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento para cuy.
Los sueños de Gloria son tener un recreo en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de alimento para cuy.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Senobia es casada, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Senobia tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijas. Además Zenobia tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Senobia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños D. Senobia son tener un recreo y un local estable.
texts.en:
Senobia is a member of the Wiñarisun, which means “Let’s Grow” in Quechua, Community Bank. Senobia is 48, married, and has three children. Senobia has a place in the F. Vivanco market where she sells food. She does this every day with help from her daughters. Zenobia also has a small grocery store in her house. Senobia needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Senobia’s dreams are to have a "recreo" (a privately owned village center for recreation and food) and a stable work place.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Reina es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Reina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales, luego los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Reina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Reina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gallina, cuy.
Los sueños de Reina son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina is a member of the Winarisun Community Bank. In Quechua, 'Winarisun' means 'May we Grow'. Reina is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She travels to different regional fairs and buys animals, then sells them in the City of Ayacucho. In addition, Reina operates a grocery store out of her house.

Reina needs a loan of $350 to buy hens and guinea pigs. She dreams of improving her business and offering a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING HENS AND GUINEA PIGS

loans.name: Mariela Catherina

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Mariela es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Mariela viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Mariela tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de abarrotes.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Mariela son sacar adelante a sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Wiñarasun Village Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in the Quechua language. She is 36, married, and has three children. She travels around to the different markets in her region buying grains, which she then sells at the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. She has plans to open a grocery store. Mariela is seeking a loan for 1000 soles to purchase rice and sugar. She dreams of getting her children ahead and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El señor Raúl M.  vive con su esposa la señora Imelda Soto en la propiedad ubicada en nuestra ciudad, el trabaja en Estados Unidos en la Aduana desde hace 15 años, su esposa se hace cargo del hogar y de la familia. 
Ellos como una familia unida están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su casa ya que meses atrás unos pandilleros se metieron a robar y por medio de este proyecto sentirán una mayor seguridad y tranquilidad en su hogar.

loans.use: Construccion de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos y su madre  en el Pueblo Joven José Olaya, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 15 años, confecciona prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, atendiendo pedidos diversos de la ciudad, esta actividad constituye la única fuente de ingreso económico de su familia, su esposo se encarga de distribuir las prendas confeccionadas.

Rosa ha sacado adelante a su negocio con el apoyo de nuestra Institución, empezó con un pequeño capital que junto a su primer crédito le sirvió para comprar su máquina de coser y desde entonces ha continuado trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para ganarse el sustento; construyó su casa y ahora planea darle a sus hijos, de 18 y 15 años de edad, estudios superiores.

El trabajo realizado por Rosa es muy bueno y original y sus prendas confeccionadas tienen mucha demanda por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito de 1500 nuevos soles a nuestra Institucion los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de telas e hilos para seguir elaborando los pedidos de sus clientes.

Durante los tres años que Rosa ha venido trabajando con nosotros ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42. She is married and lives with her husband, their two children, and her mother. They live in the Pueblo Joven José Olaya, which is located in the city of Chiclayo. She has been making clothes for 15 years. She makes articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She takes various orders from the city. This activity is the only source of income for her family. He husband is in charge of delivering the clothing that she makes. Rosa has gotten ahead in her business with the support of the Institution. She started with a small amount of money and her first loan, which she used to buy a sewing machine. From then on she has continued working with much effort to earn her sustenance. She built her house, and she now plans to give her two children, ages 18 and 15, a college education. Rosa’s work is very good and original. There is much demand for the clothing she makes. That is why she has seen the necessity of asking the Institution for a new loan for 1,500 PEN. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread to continue making her customers’ orders. During the three years that Rosa has been working with the Institution, she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments. Therefore, she is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread to make clothes

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., age 56, is a widow without any children. She lives with her elderly parents and a sister in Takeo Province. To make a living, she has been engaged in a business of manufacturing Cambodia traditional cake since 1998, typically earning an income of US $1.6 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of this, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to transport her products to her customers at the nearby local markets. By doing so, she will be able to generate additional income and help to raise a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike in order to easily transport her products to the customers

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng R., age 51, is a widow and has four children. She lives with her children in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling a kind of tools to tie the cows and buffaloes, typically earning a gross income of US $10 per day. She has to travel far away from her home to operate her business, and mostly she is able to generate maximum income in the outskirt of the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, R. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, R. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more products, a purchase that she sees a great opportunity to resell them for more income to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing ties of animals to resell

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang L., age 28, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she manufactures hammocks, typically earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate income for his family. He is a motor-taxi driver providing his services to people in the city, earning an income of US $5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband since the old motorbike consumes a lot of gasoline and needs to be repaired very often.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old and broken bike

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len L., 31, is a widow who has two children. She lives with her old mother and children in Takeo Province. To make a living, she and her mother are engaged in a business of manufacturing doormats, typically earning collectively an income of $1.60 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children, who is currently employed in a local garment factory.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, L. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to transport her doormats to sell and generate better income to achieve a good living standard for her family.

loans.use: Motorbike purchase

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn P. is 48 years old, a widow and has three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province. To make a living, she sells fruit (largely mangoes) which she buys from people in her village or nearby communities. She commutes to the city everyday to sell her fruit, typically earning $13 per day. She also gets help from her children, who work in a local garment factory.

The financial crisis has made things difficult for businesses in Cambodia over the last year. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most, particularly people like Mrs. P.. In order to overcome her economic difficulties, P. wants to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike, which would allow her to increase her income by making it easier to gather items and carry them around.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn L. is 54 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she and her husband raise pigs, and usually earn about $1.80 a day. L. also sells traditional Cambodian cakes when she is free from other work. The family also gets help from two of their children, who work in construction and sales.

The financial crisis has made things difficult for businesses in Cambodia over the last year, especially for poor people like L.. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike, which will open up a great opportunity for her husband, who could use it to work as motor-taxi driver and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S. is 29 years old, married and has two young children. She lives with her husband (who we see here) in Takeo Province. She works in a local garment factory, typically earning $3 per day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver in the city, earning $2 per day.

The financial crisis has made things difficult for businesses in Cambodia over the last year, and life is hard for its people, S. included. She is determined to overcome these difficulties by increasing her income and improving her business. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy her own tuk tuk or motorized bike, which would allow her husband to go into business providing transportation services and thereby raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk or motorized bike

loans.name: Mrs. Yi Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people living in Boeng Satong village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Yi S. is a 23- year-old village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she has a lot of consumers who need many demands. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more grocery products to add her business to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Eng Chan Veasna, is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Twelve members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To request a loan to buy more grocery products to add her business to earn more profits.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. U. is a widower who has four children. He lives with his family in Takeo Province, where he operates a motor-taxi service for tourists. He earns about $3 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for Cambodia and its people, U. included, and the economy has affected the poor the most. U. wants to increase his income and improve his business with a loan of $500 to buy a new motorbike. His current motorbike is old and needs to get repaired often. A new bike will allow him to provide comfortable transportation services to his customers, generate more income and raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
