Phoung H., age 70, is a widow who has three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, where she makes a living growing rice and earns about $2 per day. She gets help from her children, who make their living in different ways.

The financial crisis has been difficult for Cambodians and made life hard for everyone, H. included. Despite these difficulties, she is determined to increase her income and improve her life. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a photocopying machine because her house is located near a school. She hopes that the business she gets from the school will allow her to generate more income and raise her standard of living. 

We see one of her children in the picture. He operates a motor taxi in town and uses his income to help his family.

loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Phun L. is forty-nine years old and married with one school-age child. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a business of selling fish in a local market, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband also plays a major role in generating a source of income for their family. To make a living, he is engaged in a business as a motor-taxi driver, providing his services to people in the town, earning $3 a day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Phun included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, Phun is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland, a purchase that she sees as offering a great opportunity for producing more income.

loans.use: farmland purchase

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthou Tuot Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of twenty-four people who are located in Bam village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chanthou T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.

Mrs. Chanthou T. is the 24-year-old mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Chanthou T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Cham Khort, is a worker who is hired by the fisherman to help them fish.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their family’s needs. Thus, Mrs. Chanthou T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help with her rice field.

Mrs. Chan NI. S. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the photo instead.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help with her rice field

loans.name: Beg

texts.en:
Beg C. T. is thirty years old and married with three young children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a business of selling food, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family, generating income through his employment as a construction worker, earning $2 a day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, including Beg C. T.'s family. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's difficulties, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $800 to buy more fish and chickens, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity, as she can resell them at a fair and profitable price.

loans.use: To buy more fish and chickens to resell

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K., age 30, is married and has two young children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a business of weaving, typically earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate better source of income for his family. To make a living, he is engaged in a business as a taxi driver providing his services to people from his province to the city, earning US $3 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 for her husband to purchase car tires to replace his old car tires. By doing so, his car will be efficiently comfortable for his passengers and safe for his driving.

loans.use: car tire purchase

loans.name: Phot

texts.en:
Phot S. N. is thirty-three years old and married with three school-age children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a weaving business, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband also generates income for the family as a farmer, earning $2 a day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has created a difficult economic year for much of the country, the Phot S. N.'s family included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of Cambodia's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $700 to buy cows, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to produce maximum income and thus raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar T. is a 43-year-old father of two teenage daughters. He currently lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two daughters are 17 and 19-year-old and both go to a local high school. His wife is a cook and works in a small local restaurant. Chuluunbaatar currently drives a cab in the town. He has been in the taxi business since 2007. Since the start, his business has done quite well; his business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT to 400,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Chuluunbaatar hopes that he would be able to purchase new taxi for his business one day. He requests a loan to repair his old car that uses for his cab business.

loans.use: to repair his old car that uses for his cab business

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En S. K. is thirty-one years old and married with one young child. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is employed in a restaurant as a chef, typically earning an income of $4 a day. Her husband also contributes to the family's income by operating his motor-taxi in the city and other nearby places, earning $3 a day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business.  He needs to have his old motorbike repaired very often, and it consumes a lot of gasoline.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Mr. Sim Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people living in Ta Vong village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sim K. is the 59-year-old village bank president.

Mr. Sim K. is a hardworking man. His wife, Mrs. Em Sreng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. The couple has three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is a waiter.

Although Mr. Sim K.’s family members try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to supP. their household. In order to improve their living standard, Mr. Sim K. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise. He will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to supP. their rice field.

Mr. Muy C. did not come to take his loan but his wife did, so she is shown in the photo. 

Six members in this group loans have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and fertilizer to support the rice field

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Enhsaihan G. is twenty-three years old and has a one-year-old daughter. She currently lives with her husband and her baby daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She owns a small barber shop, where she works as a hairdresser. Her husband is also a barber and works in his wife's barber shop. They operate their hair- cutting business in a small room that they rent on a monthly basis. Since the start, they have been quite successful with their business and their business capital has increased from 40,000 MNT to 120,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Enhsaihan dreams of having her own work place instead of renting expensive work space for her business. 
She requests a loan to purchase new clippers and other necessary tools for her barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase new clippers and other haircutting tools

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun H. is fifty-five years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in the agricultural sector, raising crops and typically earning collectively an income of $6 a day. The family is also assisted by two of her children who are currently employed, one in a local garment factory and the other in a government institution, both with a reasonable income.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, H. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these difficulties, H. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to maximize her income from her farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon C. is a villager in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She faces a problem on the farm because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the fields. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan. She will also buy fertilizer to feed the soil and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sao Hang, is a driver. Mrs. Sokhon C. is forty-seven years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire laborers and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb K. is a farmer in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Nit, is a construction worker. He also uses a truck to transport sand to sell. Although this couple has different careers, they still want to increase their household income. Mrs. Chroeb K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy pig food and three piglets for breeding. She is twenty-three years old and the mother of a child who is just four years old. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and three piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S. is thirty-nine years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling fish and food at a tourist place in the province, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, and he uses his skill with traditional methods to fish in the river near his house, earning $3 a day. The family is also assisted by one of their children who is currently employed in a local garment factory, earning $2 a day.

The world financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a mechanical plow, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to maximize the production from her farmland.  She can also rent the plow to the farmers in her village for more income.

loans.use: Mechanical plow purchase

loans.name: Sout

texts.en:
Sout T. is thirty years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in the business of producing hand-made brooms, typically earning an income of $3 a day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed in a local garment factory earning $2.50 per day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, T. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these difficulties, T. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity, allowing her to sell her products at other far away places.

loans.use: Motorbike purchase

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng K. lives in Poun village in Takeo province. She runs a general store where she sells grocery goods, vegetables, and baskets. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Her husband, Mr. Hy Hak, is a basket maker and he is shown on the left in the photo. He is also a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he needs some money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to support the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Seng K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan S. is a 65-year-old single father and currently resides with his son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son is 20-year-old and helps in his father's business. Jargalsaihan rents a small stall in the local food market and sells various cut meat, including mutton, beef and goat meats in small pieces for locals. He usually purchases livestock, such as cattle, sheep and goats when price of livestock is low and sells them when meat price peaks during a year. Since the start in 2006, he has been quite successful with his business; his business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He says that he would like to expand his business as capital allows. Further, he would like to put aside some money for his son's future wedding, which he is very much looking forward to. 
He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for her meat retail business.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for her meat retail business.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab S. is a farmer in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she sells Bro Houk in the local market (Bro Houk is a local spelling of "prahok" - crushed, fermented fish paste that is used as a condiment).

Mrs. Leab S. is a 41-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others three are attending the local school. She is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and four piglets which she will raise to earn more income to support her family living. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon D. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. He is a cattle breeder and also a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Ouk Sary, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. This couple has five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or stuD.. His wife and children are presented in the photo with him.

Mr. Mon D. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, fishnets, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field. With this loan he hopes to increase their income and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cow, fishnets, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Mrs. Oem K. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. She is 25 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are just three and one year old. Her husband and children are shown in the photo with her.

Mrs. Oem K. is a cake maker. In her business, she needs a loan to buy a machine to make more cakes to sell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Samnang, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice.

loans.use: To buy machine to make more cakes to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver T. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. He is 30 years old. Oliver is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Oliver owns & operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Oliver has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Oliver joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliver has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Oliver is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Oliver from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn V. is from the village of Biasong. She is 32 years old. Analyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her fishing business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of Lao Sta Cruz. She is 56 years old. Elena is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elena is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en: Dasola is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells engine oil and has been in the business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She has been in the business since 1990. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Tayo

texts.en: Tayo is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She has a shop where she sells medicine and provisions. She is requesting for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicine and provisions so that she meet up with the increasing number of her customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medical drugs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Liala is 29 years of age. She is married to 40-year-old Rolento, who is a laborer, and they have three children whose ages range from two to six years old.

Five years ago, Laila had a loan from Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) and started her own business buying and selling salt to augment her husband's income. At the start, profit wasn't really enough to sustain her business and supply her family's needs. Nevertheless, Laila used her income wisely so she was able to repay her loan on time, so that she would be able to take out a bigger loan in order to grow her business. Her business has done so well that Laila has been able to use her profits to purchase a motorcycle for use in her business. She also has been able to start another business, hog fattening (pig raising), in order to augment her profit from her other business. With hog fattening, a pig can be raised in four months, and the selling price is double the price of the piglet.

With her business success, Laila wants to to take out a bigger loan from ASHI to expand her business and make it more stable in preparation for her children's education and future.

loans.use: To finance her business of buying and selling salt

loans.name: Olusola

texts.en: Olusola is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 35 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She sells palm oil and has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 30 years old woman,she is  married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 10 and 17 years.

Elizabeth started her own cafe business selling food 1 year ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Elizabeth first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,sugar,salts for food.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Elizabeth hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking oil,sugar,for food

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda A. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 37 years old. Criselda is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Criselda provides multicab transportation services to local community members. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Criselda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Criselda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 15 and 18 years.

Joyce started her own cafe  business selling  food 1 year ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 10,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joyce first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 In order to buy more commodities like sugar,salts for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan Itiji hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,cooking oil,salts

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio F. is from the village of Casusan. He is 47 years old. Lucio is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lucio makes and sells household furniture to local businesses and community members. Lucio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lucio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lucio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Margarita Reina

texts.es: Margarita Reina R. D. M. D. 57 años D. edad resiD. en Ilopango municipio D. San Salvador. Margarita vive solamente con su esposo que trabaja como comerciante. Margarita tiene una tienda ubicada en su casa la cual es  atendida por ella en el transcurso D.  toda la semana, Margarita viaja a comprar toda su mercadería una vez a la semana para surtir su tienda con buenos productos y a su vez le generen buenas ganancias, el crédito que solicita Margarita es para surtir su negocio con otros productos los cuales no es posible adquirir sin la ayuda D. este crédito.
texts.en:
Margarita Reina R. D. M. is 57 years old and lives in Ilopango, a municipality of San Salvador. Margarita lives only with her husband who works as a shopkeeper. Margarita has a store located in her house which she looks after throughout the course of the week. Margarita travels to buy all her merchandize once a week stocking her store with good products and in turn generating a good income. The loan Margarita is asking for is to stock her business with other products which would not possible to acquire without the aid of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a store

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: N. Irene is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is 28 years old and married with 4 children aged 10 – 2 years all in school. Irene has a maize selling business for 3 years in Kampala where she makes monthly profits of 100,000/= and it’s her high level of faithfulness that is enabling her to hold on to her customers for increased sales. She has a plan of increasing her stock by having more bags of maize and beans for resale so that she could earn more to be able to take care of her family well. She needs a loan to be able to increase her capital by increasing more stock of her produce.

loans.use: Buying more bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy K. is aged 41-years-old, separated with his wife and helives alone. Sammy is in the business of manufacturing  liquid detergents and he has been in that business for the last four years. He mainly supplies the detergents to retail outlets at wholesale prices.

This loan marks Sammy's first borrowing from KADET and with it he intends to purchase ingredients and chemicals for the manufacture of both industrial and domestic detergents. He also intends to purchase packaging and labeling materials.

In future Sammy hopes to produce a top quality detergent that will position itself in the Kenyan market.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchasing  ingredients and chemicals for making detergents and the packaging and labeling materials for the detergents.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of the Itiji borrower group in Itiji,Mneya ,she is 48 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 5 and 11 years.

Sarah started her own business selling local alcohol 7 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 260,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sarah first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Sarah hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local alcohol

loans.name: Aeshboi

texts.ru: Эшбой Хочиев проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Эшбой вместе со своей семьей работает в колхозе. Он также более 8 лет занимается животноводством, откармливает и продает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Aeshboi H. lives in the Rumy district. He is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. Aeshboi and his family work at a collective farm. He also has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He raises and sells cattle and small livestock. He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Gloria Evelyn

texts.es: Gloria Evelyn V. D. LandaverD. resiD. en Santa Tecla municipio D. La Libertad. Gloria tiene 52 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo Arturo y sus tres hijos, todos estudiantes. Gloria ha trabajado gran parte D. su vida en la confección D. ropa para cama, accesorios D. baño y  también elaborando ropa a la medida; con dieciocho años D. experiencia Gloria ha ganado una clientela my estable. El crédito que solicita Gloria es para comprar gran cantidad en telas y listones, ya que se aproximan las fechas en que elabora vestidos típicos para las fechas cívicas en el mes D. septiembre y necesita tener suficiente materia prima para no fallarle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria Evelyn V. D. LandaverD. lives in the Santa Tecla municipality in La Libertad. Gloria is 52. She lives in her own house with her husband, Arturo, and their three children. All of her children are students. Gloria has worked a large part of her life making bedding, bath accessories, and also making custom clothing. With 18 years of experience, she has gained a very stable customer base. The loan that Gloria is asking for is to buy a large quantity of fabric and ribbons. The time is approaching when she makes typical clothing for the civic celebrations in the month of September. She needs to have enough raw material so that she will not let her customers down.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Grandensio's Group

texts.en:
N. Grandensia is the leader of her lending group in Seguku. She is 50 years old and married. She has 2 dependents and  she helps to take care of 7 orphans. All of the children go to school. 

She is a businesswoman who sells charcoal and matooke at the Seguku Trading Centre. Although the competition is stiff, she is able to make 30,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profits each week. Her loans have enabled her to own a house for her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business further because her family grows by the day. Grandensia says that, although she has two main businesses, she also sells other produce, such  as cassava, irish potatoes, and cabbage. She needs a loan to help restock her business with a variety of food.

loans.use: To buy more matooke and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Atuganile

texts.en:
Atuganile is a member of the Itiji 05 borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 33 years old woman,she is Married and a mother of 3 children.

Atuganile started her own grocery business selling beer,soda 10 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Atuganile`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer,soda.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan ,Atuganile hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Esther Betsabe

texts.es: Esther Betsabe B. A. vive en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Esther tiene tan solo 19 años de edad se encuentra acompañada con Walter de 21 años quien trabaja como albañil y da un aporte de $100 US, con ellos vive la madre de Esther quien ayuda a su hija en el negocio. Esther posee una pupuseria la cual es administrada por ella y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para atender el negocio. Esther obtiene buenos ingresos a través de sus ventas ya que no posee competencia en la zona. Esther solicita este crédito para comprar materia prima que le permita aumentar su producción al igual que sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia H.  D. L. resiD. en Apopa municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Con 30 años D. edad Marta  es una mujer casada con Ramón quien trabaja como comerciante aportando a la familia $150.00 US, con ellos viven sus dos pequeños niños que se encuentran estudiando. Marta coopera con los gastos económicos D. la familia, hace cuatro años ella monto un pequeño puesto en una escuela donD. venD. pupusas, papas fritas, panes entre otros, las ventas D. Marta son seguras por poseer una clientela estable y ahora ha decido aumentar su producción ya que a veces no logra cubrir la demanda D. sus productos, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima que le permita elaborar mayor cantidad D. sus platillos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Ulises Alexander

texts.es: Ulises Alexander S. R. reside en la capital de El Salvador. Ulises vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Ulises es un padre muy responsable tras la dificultad no encontrar ningún trabajo estable por no tener ningún nivel de educación escolar, Ulises tuvo la idea de montar un negocio, el cual le permitirá sostener s su familia, y es así como Ulises lleva el pan a la mesa de casa, con una tienda que el monto hace unos años logra obtener todos sus ingresos, la tienda se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y es por eso que sus ventas evidentes ya que transita mucho estudiante y diversas personas que van para el punto de buses, ahora Ulises desea incrementar y solidificar su negocio surtiéndolo con variedad de productos y es por eso que hoy solita este crédito.
texts.en:
Ulises Alexander S. R. lives in the capital of El Salvador. Ulises lives with his wife and their small two year old son. Ulises is a very responsible father. Encountering difficulty finding stable work because he is not educated, Ulises had the idea to start a business to support his family. That is how Ulises brings bread to the table at his house. He started a business a few years ago. He has a store, which is how he gets all of his income. The store is located in a good area. He gets sales because many students and various people go to the bus station. Ulises now wishes to increase and solidify his business by stocking it with a variety of products. That is why he is now asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
K. Moses is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 30 years old and married with 2 children aged 6 and 2 years. He also cares for 3 dependents. 

For nine years, Moses has run a barber shop in Kasubi where he specializes in cutting and trimming men’s hair. He says that his biggest challenges are customers who get used to him and begin making late payments, thereby harming his cash flow, and the unstable power supply, which keeps him from working most of the time. However, he has been able to stay in business because of his perseverance and his good customer care. 

He hopes to own his salon site and educate his children to university level. He also plans to buy a generator so that he can eliminate his power problems. He is grateful for his loans because they have helped him so much.

loans.use: Buy salon equipment such as shavers, spirits, combs and brushes

loans.name: Ilemi A Group

texts.en:
oliva is a member of the Ilemi A borrower group in Mwanjelwa,Mbeya ,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 14,8 and 4 years.

Oliva started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Oliva`s first Loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this ,loan Oliva hopes to save more money,get more food for family, and expand her business.

Annastanzia is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 100,000 Tsh In order to expand her food business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Sonia Caridad

texts.es: Sonia Caridad P. D. F. resiD. en la capital del país en unos D. los municipios más poblados Soyapango. Sonia tiene 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos uno D. ellos es empleado y el otro se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Sonia se dedica a la venta D. productos D. perfumería, cremas corporales, zapatos entre otros; Sonia posee una clientela ya establecida y obtiene un buen margen D. ganancia. El crédito que solicita para invertirlo en productos nuevos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Caridad P. D. F. lives in Soyapango, one of the most populated municipalities in the capital of the country. Sonia is 46. She lives with her husband and their two children. One of the children is employed, and the other is attending the university. Sonia sells perfume products, body creams, shoes, and other things. Sonia has an established customer base, and she has a good margin of earnings. The loan she is asking for is to buy new products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong S., age 37, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh. To make a living, she buys palm sugar from the local farmers in her village and resells it at the provincial town, typically earning an income of US $3.00 per day in revenue. She is assisted by her husband, a public school teacher who earns US $3.00 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase more palm sugar to expand he inventory. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to provide a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary N. is a determined and hard-working lady. She has run a retail shop and a waragi (Ugandan beer) business for 7 years in Luwayo. She is a single mother of 7 children aged 32-12 years. She also cares for 4 dependents. She is happy to say that her previous loans have enabled her children attend school. Two have graduated from university, one is now taking a course of study, and the rest are in secondary schools. 

In her shop, Mary sells food and refreshments. As a result, she makes 200,000/= ("/=" is the symbol for Ugandan shillings) in profit each month. She has a strong plan too expand her shop to earn more income for her children’s continued education and general upkeep. 

She needs a loan to help purchase more stock for her grocery shop. She is 48 years old and divorced. Her hard work has benefited her and her family a lot.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more products and buying more raw materials for making waragi.

loans.name: Nevi

texts.en:
Nevi is a member of the Juhudi,borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 12,06,02 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Nevi started her own clothing business selling clothes 4 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Nevi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Nevi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 66 years old. She has been farming rice for seven years. She used a loan from well-off people in her village to start her rice farm. Although the local loan had a high monthly interest rate, Erlinda had no choice but to take it, despite the risk, because she needed her own business to meet the needs of her two children, especially their education. 
Erlinda's husband is a farmer, so it was not a problem to find someone to look after and work in the rice field. 

When Erlinda joined Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), she was able to get a low-interest loan for her business that was easy to pay, because the mode of payment depends on her ability to pay. She then stopped borrowing from usurious money lenders in her village. Since then, the woman's business started to earn larger profits. With her business profits, she has been able to expand her business and send her two children to college (one has already graduated), and she has started another business raising livestock in her back yard.

Erlinda is still an active member of ASHI and has maintained her good track record of repayment and attendance at weekly center meetings. She wants to borrow a larger amount to expand and improve her business. She wants her rice production business to become stable and profitable so she can help needy people and relatives in her village.

loans.use: To finance her rice farm

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en: N. Rosemary is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 36 years old and married with 5 children with ages ranging from 20 to two. She also cares for five dependents. Rosemary operates a business where she makes and sells waragi, a local brew. She has also been a clothes dealer for 15 years. She is grateful for her businesses because she has ready customers who take the goods on order. She dreams of buying a pick-up truck to ease the transport costs.  she also hopes to educate all her children. Rosemary needs a loan to help buy more raw materials like sukali gulu, a kind of sugar, for business recapitalization.

loans.use: Buying more raw materials for making local brew for resale.

loans.name: Adidas Group

texts.en:
David L., 31, is a married father of two children ages 8 and 3. He operates a barber shop which he started in 2008.  He works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to able to earn a monthly profit of about $304 US.

This will be David’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to improve the barber shop and has paid his loans back successfully. He now hopes for a new loan to further improve his business.

David will share this loan with subgroup A of the Adidas group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run shops, salons, and tailor and sell clothes. These members hold each other accountable to pay back their loans. In the picture, David is second from left in a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: To improve his barber shop.

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en: L. Leah is a 30-year-old married mother of 2 children aged 8 and 2. She also cares for 3 dependants. She has been a business lady with a drug shop in the Matale trading centre for 8 years. Her biggest challenges are the debtors that take drugs and do not want to pay in time, the high rental expenses, and her seasonal customers. Leah is seeking her 29th loan from Pearl Microfinance in order to restock her drug shop. At the moment, she is able to make 300,000 Ugandan shillings (or about $150) per month in profits. This has enabled her to educate her children and cater for their clothing needs on time and whenever the need arises.

loans.use: To increase her stock of drugs in her drug store.

loans.name: Diana Aimee

texts.es: Diana Aimee R. E. reside en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. Diana tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su madre, padrastro e hijo de 4 años de edad estudiante de kínder. Diana se ha visto en la necesidad de dejar a un lado sus estudios y planes como profesional ya que por ser madre soltera no cuenta con respaldo económico, es por eso que Diana creó su propio negocio donde vende variedad de artesanía salvadoreñas, sus productos son demandados por los salvadoreños y extranjeros que quieren llevarse un recuerdo de nuestra tierra. Ahora Diana solita un crédito para comprar mas variedad de artesanías para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Diana Aimee R. E. live in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. Diana is 29. She lives with her mother, stepfather, and her four year old son. He is kindergarten age. Diana saw the need to leave her studies and plans to become a professional because being a single mother, she does not have economic support. That is why Diana created her own business. She sells a variety of Salvadoran handicrafts. Her products are in demand by Salvadorians as well as foreigners who want to have a souvenir of her country. Diana is now asking for a loan to buy a greater variety of handicrafts to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda D. D. E. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango en la capital del país. Benilda vive con su esposo e hijo , Benilda posee un negocio en su casa para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha montado una venta D. pupusas donD. también venD. variedad D. comidas   y bebidas, Benilda posee siete  años D. experiencia manteniendo D. pie y con éxito su negocio, ahora Benilda solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
N. Immaculate is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a very hard working lady with a business of selling second hand clothes from Lugazi and the neighboring towns, especially from the daily markets.

This is her first loan with the group and her main motive is to recapitalize her business with more quality and quantity of clothes so that she can make more profits to pay school fees for her children and to take care of their other needs. She is happy to be a part of this group because it is not easy to find someone to give you money these days.

loans.use: Buying more stock of clothings for business continuity.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan N. lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

Her husband, Mr. Thin Thorn, is a duck breeder who has a business selling duck eggs. He is shown in the picture with her. Since his duck-egg business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chan N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding to produce more eggs.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to produce more eggs

loans.name: Anzeni

texts.en:
Anzeni is a member of the Ushirika borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 38 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 18,14,09 years.

Anzeni started her own cafe business selling food 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Anzeni`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,sugar,salts for business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Anzeni hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build more fish cages.

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mwajabu is a member of the Imani borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 33 years old woman,she is married a and  a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 10,5,3 years.

Mwajabu started her own business selling clothes 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mwajabu`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale,

With the additional;l profit she gains from the use of this loan Mwajabu hopes to save money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a member of the Hadhina borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 43 years old woman,she is separated from her husband and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 21 and 18 years.

Prisca started her own food business selling tomatoes,potatoes,onions, 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Prisca`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,potatoes etc for sale .

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Prisca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,onions,potatoes for sale

loans.name: Buntha

texts.en:
Mr. Buntha S. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. Aside from this work, he is also a fisherman and a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He is the 36-year-old father of three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their household. Mr. Buntha S. is requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike, fertilizer and a fishnet. He would use the rest of money to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike, fertilizer, a fishnet and a piglet

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Sekela is a member of the Furaha borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 10,07,5, years.

Sekela started her own clothing  business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sekela first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Sekela hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Jane,Karister are also the member of the same borrower group,they requested the loan amount 150,000 and 100,000 respectively in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Mrs. Koeun V. lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phorn, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard to earn money, they still do not have a better house for their family living. Thus, Mrs. Koeun V. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy some timbers and the others equipments to build the house. She is a 27-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy some timbers and the others equipments to build the house.

loans.name: Adelvina

texts.en:
Adelvina is a member of the Songambele borrower group in Sakina,Arusha,she is 33 years old woman,she is single and she cares for 3 dependents.

Adelvina started her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Adelvina first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Adelvina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Seur

texts.en:
Mrs. Seur S. is a farmer in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice.

Mrs. Seur S. also raises pigs and, since her business of raising pigs is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow.

Mrs. Seur S. is a 45-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is a vet in the local village and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and pig food and to buy a cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lutaaya's Group

texts.en: N. Lutaaya is the leader of her lending group in Kiyunga, Lugazi. She is 28 years old and a mother of 4 children of which 3 are school going while the last born is a baby. She is a very hard working lady with two businesses that is to say; she is a farmer growing food both for sale and home consumption and also she has a business of selling clothes from Kiyunga and the neighboring trading centres. In the farming business, she has been working hand in hand with her husband and the little savings she made, enabled her to start up the clothes selling business. She has decided to ask for a loan to help increase the stock and quality of her clothes so that she could make more profits out of it.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she needs one more buffalo to plow the field.

Mrs. Sokha K. is a 48-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another sells desserts and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo to plow her field

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is amember of the itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 12,15,18, and 20 years.

Eva started her own shop business selling rice,salts,cooking oil 1 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eva first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities like rice etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Eva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Art N. is villager in Trapaing Chhouk village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Yorng Kimly, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He now wants to help his wife’s business by expanding it. Now Mrs. Sam Art N. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a motorbike to transport the vegetables to sell at the market. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a motorbike to transport the vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun S. ilives in Korn Saom Ork village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Lim Vein, owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Aun S. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer who helps the father’s work while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Latt

texts.en: Mrs. Latt K. is a farmer in Kouk Doung village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she has a problem because her field is infertile which it is a bad to affect to her crop. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Ank Oeurn, owns an electric cow which been hired by the villagers to plow on the field and to transport the rice. This couple has four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iman Group

texts.en:
Jaquiline is a member of the Iman borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 8 years.

Jaquiline started her own tailoring business 15 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jaquline second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 500,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Jaquline hopes to save money and expand her business.

Beatrice,Monica are also the member of the same borrower group,they requested loan amount 400,000Tsh and 500,000Tsh respectively in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce K. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a widow with 7 children.  Four of them attend secondary school, one is in her second year at the University, another is taking a course, and another is out of school. 

Joyce is a businesswoman who has been selling charcoal from her home in Kyaliwajjala for a very long time. She says that although this is her first loan with Pearl Microfinance, she and her husband had taken out loans before he died and the loans helped them with both their business and family. She now requests a loan to buy more bags of charcoal from the villages so that she can resell it at a profit.  With the income she will help pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim M. is a villager in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and is far from the irrigation system. In order to deal with this, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump to pump water to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Nuon Sao, is a hardworking man who is hired by the villagers to work on their fields. Mrs. Yim M. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a farmer while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and an irrigation pump

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C. lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She is a flower seller. Her husband, Mr. Sao Bunleng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is shown with her in the photo.

Now, Mrs. Sophal C. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to more easily take her flowers to sell at the market. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike to more easily take her flowers to sell at the market

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann C. is a villager in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to pay for paddy farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, gasoline, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Sovann C.’s husband, Mr. Art Sophal, is a construction worker. He is shown on the right in the photo. This couple has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, gasoline, and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en: F. Patrick is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 38 years old and married with 6 children aged 16 – 2 years plus caring for other orphans. Patrick has a grocery business in Kame valley market for 8 years where he sells general merchandise like sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil and others and although at the moment he makes weekly profits of 50,000/=, he would like this to increase as a result of increasing the stock of products in his grocery store. He is a friendly and hard working man and works so hard to ensure that his family is good and healthy. He needs a loan to help restock his store.

loans.use: Restocking his grocery store with more products.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mr. Horn S. was born in 1968 and he now lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker.

His wife, Mrs. Y Sarvoeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a water lily seller in the local market. His wife is shown with him in the photo. The couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Now Mr. Horn S. is applying a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding and to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding and to plow the field

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ung Muny, is a motorbike taxi driver. He also uses the cart with his motor to transport the goods and passengers. Now he has a problem because of his cart can not transport. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to fix the cart for her husband’s transporting. She is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is just one years old. Her husband is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix the cart for her husband’s transporting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Oeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeth C. is a villager in Poun Village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Saesh Net, is shown in the photo with her. The couple has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Mrs. Oeth C.’s husband is farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he needs some money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer to support the crop. Thus, Mrs. Oeth C. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Lady

texts.en:
Maria Lady P. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. Maria Lady has owned a bakery for over 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP.

Maria Lady joined HSPFI in 1997 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and run her bakery. She has successfully repaid a HSPFI loan of 15,000 PHP which was invested in the bakery, and she is now requesting her 19th loan of 15,000 PHP to further invest in her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in her bakery.

loans.name: Kim Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Kim ChH. H. is a farmer in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Uch Kimsay, is a hard working man who has been hired by the villagers to use the electric cow for plowing on the field. Now this couple has a problem because they need some money to buy fertilizer to support the rice field and to fix electric cow. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Kim ChH. H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 43 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of picture.

loans.use: Need some money to buy fertilizer to support the rice field and to fix electric cow.

loans.name: Caritas

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali-Rwanda,

Caritas M. is a widow of 41 years old, has 5 children and she has been in business of shopping for the past 5 years.

Caritas is requesting her third loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With her two previous loans,she was able to expand her business through purchasing beers for sales and she is proud of that. Now with this loan, she hopes to create 4 jobs and with the more profits she will getting, she plans to help her husband to have a strong family.

Through accessing this loan, Caritas has hope for the future of her family.

loans.use: more products

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en: Maria S. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. She is a strong businesswoman with a retail shop in Bugoba that she has owned 7 years. She is happy to be part of her lending group because she dreams of transforming her shop by stocking it with more goods for sale. The profits she makes enable her to save for her children’s education and the remainder is used for business recapitalization and family welfare. She needs a loan to help buy more goods for restocking her retail shop with sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Jazira

texts.en:
Jazira is a member of the Zizi la ngombe borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 7 children.Her children are aged 22,21,18,16,15,15,6 years.

Jazira started her own shop business selling cooking oil,salts etc 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jazira first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Jazira hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil,wheat,salts

loans.name: Dumat-Ol

texts.en:
Dumat-ol E. is from the village of Bongbongon, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dumat-ol runs a sari-sari shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dumat-ol has run the shop for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Dumat-ol joined HSPFI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and help finance her shop. She has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 18,000 PHP which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dumat-ol is now requesting her 8th loan, for 21,000 PHP, to further expand the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in her sari-sari shop.

loans.name: Aishat

texts.en: Aishat is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells medicine. She has been in business for the past 2 years. She is requesting for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more medical products to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She sells used clothes and vegetable oil and she has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more used clothes and vegetable oil to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. is a farmer in Poun village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because her field is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, piglets and pig food for breeding pigs business. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Hing Pun, is a teacher in the local school. This couple has five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, piglets and pig food for breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Tundaan

texts.en:
Tundaan M. is from the village of Puntian in Quezon in the Bukidnon Province. She is 37 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Tundaan sells home products and furniture to tourists and local community members. Tundaan has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Tundaan joined HSPFI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tundaan has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 20,000 PHP which was used to expand her product offering. Now Tundaan requests her 5th new loan, for 23,000 PHP, to further expand the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Koem En

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem En P. lives in Poun village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Koem En P. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sopheak, is a motorbike taxi driver and he is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the rice field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jemedar Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Jemedar borrower group in Sakina,Arusha,she is 37 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 21,17 and 10 years.

Zuhura started her own clothing business selling clothes 6 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 350,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zuhura`s first loan form BRAC_Tanzani,she requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Zuhura hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Suzan,Sophia,Adia,Agness are also the member of the same borrower group,they requested the loan in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Theodomir

texts.en:
Theodomir B. is 27 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents. He owns a small shop selling different kinds of products as seen in the picture. He has an experience of 11 years. He works every day from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM, and his monthly profit is 100,000 RWF.

Theodomir is requesting his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company s.a. With this new loan, he hopes to expand his business through purchasing more products for sale, and as he will be getting more profit, he hopes also to buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy more products for his shop

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng S. is a farmer in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. She needs some money to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on her field. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan.
